characters: AND STABS RACHEL IN THE STOMACH.
POLICE OFFICERS, DETECTIVES, NEWS VANS, REPORTERS, NEIGHB
NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET, MY BLOODY
A HAND BURSTS THROUGH THE DRIVER'S WINDOW GRABBING HER
A GHOST FACE KILLER SPRINGS FROM THE DARKNESS
GHOSTFACE ON THE FRONT PORCH. KNIFE RAISED. HE STRIKES,
THE KNIFE SLICES HIS NECK OPEN
AT THE END OF THE HALL
HOUSE ON THE LEFT, FRIDAY THE 13TH,
PROM NIGHT, HOUSE OF WAX, PIRAHNA,
TEXAS CHAINSAW, DAWN OF THE DEAD,
IN A FLASH, CHLOE PULLS A BUTCHER KNIFE FROM UNDER A PILL

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: On a RINGING phone. A hand reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: Hello? A young girl of 17. Sweet. Innocent in that scrubbed clea way. Looks like a virgin. Probably not.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (from phone) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: Who are you calling?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Who am I speaking to?

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: Wrong number. CLICK. Sherrie hangs up. Not very polite about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherrie joins Trudie, 16, a sexy, pretty. Tells it like i is. Trudie is snacking on chips while TEXTING on her SIDEKICK. Two friends hanging out.

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: Nobody. Are you making popcorn?

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: No, did you pick a movie?

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: We're going scary. SAW 4. Sherrie searches the cabinets and fridge for food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw it in the theater. It sucks. And it’s not scary -- it’s gross. I hate that torture porn shit.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: How do you really feel? I like Jigsaw. He kills people very creatively.

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: But you don’t give a shit who dies. There’s no character development. Just body parts ripping and blood spewing. Blaaaah.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: Who do you keep texting?

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: I have a Facebook stalker. He keeps leaving me messages.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: Just stuff. Like, “Hey, what’s up. You're hot. I wanna kill you.”

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: Delete him.

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: I did. He hacked his way back in.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: Report him.

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: He’s really hot. Wanna see? Sherrie joins Trudie as she pulls up a profile. A glimpse a shirtless young hottie.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: That's Channing Tatum. It’s hard to make out on the small screen.

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: It is not? Is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From his Abercrombie days. You're being punked. The PHONE RINGS again. Sherrie goes for the kitchen phone

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (from phone) Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: The more impatient version of the person you just spoke to.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. You don’t have to be a bitch about it.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: Of course I don’t. Eat me. Annoyed, Sherrie starts to hang up when--

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: You hang up on me and I’11 cut into your neck until I feel bone. Sherrie stops in her tracks. Stunned. Trudie looks at her

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: (to Sherrie) Who is it? Sherrie’s not sure what to think. So she holds out the phone.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: It’s for you. Trudie takes it. Hesitantly.

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: (into phone) Trudie. Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the last person you’re ever going to see alive. Trudie looks to Sherrie. WTF?

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: hn (into phone) What?

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: It’s a prank. Hang up. Trudie hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: Why’d you hand the phone to me?

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: You’re the one with the stalker.

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: Are the doors locked?

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: Don’t freak out. The phone RINGS again. They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: Let it ring. Beat. The RINGING stops. They look relieved. Then, Trudie’s SIDEKICK buzzes on the kitchen counter. She pick it up. Reads.

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (reading) It’s from stalker boy. (holds it up) “Answer the phone.”

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: Oh for god's sake. It’s a joke, Trudie. I bet it’s Lexi or Karen. Trudie takes off for the living room.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: To make sure the front door is locked.  Sherrie follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come to the front door. Trudie checks the locks as Sherrie watches. Trudie turns back to Sherrie when... The DOORBELL RINGS. They both SCREAM. Staring at the fron door. Sherrie starts for it. Trudie stops her.

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: Don’t answer it.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: It’s a joke, Trudie. Someone made a dummy profile and now they’re trying to scare you.

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: (calling out) Who is it? (no answer) I said -- who is it? (still no answer) Let’s call the cops. Just then, Trudie’s SIDEKICK BUZZES with a message. Trudi jumps out of her skin. She looks at it, reading.

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “I dare you to open the door.” Trudie’s officially terrified. Sherrie is not quite sold. She's contemplating opening the door.

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, Sherrie. Don’t.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE
dialogues.text: Who emails you from the front porch? Trudie shrugs. Has no idea.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One of our asshole friends, that’s who. I bet it’s Karen and Lexi. Sherrie starts for the door. Trudie stops her.

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: No, don’t, I’m scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Barry or Lance. It could be anyone we know. Lisa, Bailey, Wayne, or the hopeful long shot -- Channing Tatum. Sherrie goes to the front door -- unlocks it. Trudie step back, shaking. As the door rips open revealing-- AN EMPTY DOORWAY. No one’s there. Sherrie steps outside onto the porch. Trudie watches her as she looks around. She shrugs, turni back to Trudie.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s no one out here. Sherrie stands in the doorway, facing Trudie -- her back exposed to the outside. Just then... Trudie’s SIDEKICK BUZZES in her hands. Trudie looks, open it up.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What does it say? Trudie reads her phone.

dialogues.speaker: TRUDIE
dialogues.text: It says, “I’m not outside. I’m right behind...” TRUDIE has time to register this. She spins around to see

dialogues.speaker: HER. KNIFE IN THE AIR.
dialogues.text: Sherrie SCREAMS for her friend, watching as the GHOST FAC stabs Trudie. The knife penetrates deep. Upon its withdrawl, Trudie drops instantly. Dead. Sherrie stands frozen. Until the GHOST FACE turns his attention to her. That’s all it takes for Sherrie to flee She spins around. Starts out the front door when-- ANOTHER GHOST FACE KILLER APPEARS on the porch, completel surprising her. Sherrie starts to SCREAM but the GHOST FACE is too fast. flash of silver. A KNIFE SLICES SHERRIE’S THROAT. STIFLING HER SCREAM. She stands there a moment, clutching her neck as the blo pours from it. Unable to scream. A look of confusion and helplessness. A beat. As she GURGLES for air. Then -- out of nowhere -- A MADDENING SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You're fucking kidding me. Suddenly, the CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL--

dialogues.speaker: A TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: It becomes clear the previous sequence was merely the ope scene from a movie on television. As the CAMERA PULLS BACK FURTHER REVEALING -- TWO TEEN GI on a couch. In a different living room. In a different house. They are watching the horror movie STAB 6. RACHEL and CHLOE, both 17. Best friends. Rachel grabs the remote. Shuts off the TV. She’s the more outspoken one.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: That was so fucking stupid. Pure horse shit. The death of horror. Right here. In front of us. Chloe is more reserved. She tries to defend it.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: I jumped. It scared me.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: A fucking Facebook killer? You're kidding me, right?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: It’s a few years old. Now, it would be twitter. Which would make a lot more sense. Rachel gets up and goes to the kitchen. Opens the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bunch of articulate teenagers sit around and deconstruct horror movies until a ghost face kills them one by one. It’s been done to death. The whole self-aware, post-— modern meta-shit is over. Stick a fork in 1996 already. Chloe stays in the living room. It’s an open floor plan s they can see each other.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: I like STAB movies. They’re scarier. It’s not torture porn or zombies or aliens or Asian ghost girls. There’s something real about a guy with a knife. Who just snaps. It could really happen. Rachel opens a soda and starts back to the couch where sh plops back down next to Chloe.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I can’t do it. These sequels don’t know when to stop. They just keep recycling the same shit. Even the opening scene. Some random girl gets a call that undoubtedly ends in her getting killed. It’s all so predictable, there’s no element of surprise, you see everything coming...

dialogues.speaker: AND STABS RACHEL IN THE STOMACH.
dialogues.text: Blood spews as Rachel registers surprise. Shock. A very unpredictable moment. Rachel looks down and stares at the knife in her stomach. Complete and insidious horror. As her friend Chloe’s face turns maniacal and evil. She pulls the knife out.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Did that surprise you? Rachel tries to speak, but spits up blood. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (barely audible) Why.... Chloe stabs her again. Deeper this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you talk too much. Now shut the fuck up and watch the movie. Rachel's body goes slack. As she sits there. On the couch Bleeding to death. Chloe reaches for the remote. And as Rachel nears death, Chloe HITS PLAY. A MADDENING SCREAM. CUT TO BLACK. MAIN TITLE CARD. AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: STAB 7
dialogues.text: The CAMERA PULLS BACK REVEALING--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TV SET. The previous scene was also another fake out. TWO TEEN GIRLS are lounging in a family room of a large house. JENNY, 16, cute and bouncy, sits up LAUGHING uncontrollably. She hits PAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Oh God, I love it. I’ve seen this movie five times. It gets me every time. Her friend, MARNIE, 16, brainy, over-achiever.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: You're kidding? I don’t get it.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: It’s like a TWILIGHT ZONE movie within a movie.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: I get that. But it’s illogical. It begs the question. If the beginning of STAB 7 is STAB 6? What’s at the beginning of STAB 6? STAB 5? And, if so, what was STAB 4 about? Jenny stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: You're over-thinking it.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: You know what kills me? Somewhere, someone thought that was clever. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s a reason I don’t watch these movies.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you've never seen them. We live in Woodsboro.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: This has nothing to do with Woodsboro. I thought STAB was based on true stories.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: The first three, the trilogy, was all about Sidney Prescott and the Woodsboro Murders.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: You know my mom went to school with her--

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: After that, they just kept making lame ass sequels. Money.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: Do we have to finish it? I know it’s the anniversary of the Woodsboro massacre but I hate horror. Jenny smiles. Of course, she does. Just then, she looks t the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: I didn’t hear anything. Jenny rises. Starts towards the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: Don’t try and scare me. I didn’t hear anything.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I’m not trying to scare you.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: You do this all the time.  No, 11

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: Halloween night? When I walked into the kitchen and found you dead on It the floor with blood everywhere?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: was Halloween. Lighten up. Jenny moves to the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I heard something. Marnie doesn’t believe her. But still...

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: Are we the only ones here? Jenny nods.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I’m gonna check it out.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: I know you’re trying to scare me.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I swear I’m not. Jenny takes off for the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s dark. Jenny moves down it quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marnie waits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny enters open window. and watches from the living room. Uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: her bedroom. Simple. Sweet. She notices an

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What is it? Jenny calls out.  12

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I left a window open.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FAMILY ROOM
dialogues.text: Marnie hears that. Calls out.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: That was stupid.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I’m just gonna check it out.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FAMILY ROOM
dialogues.text: Marnie looks around. Goes to the back patio sliding doors Checks to make sure they’re locked. Just then, the PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Will you get that?

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Jenny has a cell phone in her hand. She’s the one who’s calling her own house.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marnie?

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FAMILY ROOM
dialogues.text: Marnie goes to the phone. Answers it.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Hello. Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: Marnie. Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: The last person you’re ever going to see alive.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: So lame. Just then, Jenny BURSTS out LAUGHING.  13

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I had to.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: (from phone) You bitch. So not funny. Jenny’s very amused with herself.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Somebody falls for it every year.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know why you get off on this shit -- AAHHHH... Just then, Marnie SCREAMS. It’s a DEADLY SCREAM. Then, th line goes dead. Jenny pauses.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: (into phone) Marnie? Marnie? Jenny looks to the bedroom door. Is she being pranked? Th SCREAM was very real. She gets up and starts for the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny moves down the hallway. Back to the family room.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Marnie? Suddenly, a CRASHING NOISE. Something is upturned. It’s followed by silence. Jenny’s looking a little scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny enters to find the room completely dark and empty. back patio doors are wide open. Jenny looks around.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Marnie? Where’d you go? Jenny circles around the couch. Stumbles over something. Tripping. She looks down and sees Marnie lying dead on th floor. Her eyes COLD and LIFELESS. Jenny SCREAMS. Just then, Marnie sits up LAUGHING UNCONTROLLABLY. Jenny’s been punked. A victim of her own prank.  14

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: Gotchya. You should have seen your face. Jenny knows she can’t be mad.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I knew you were up to something. How’d you do the voice on the phone?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: An app I downloaded. Marnie gets up. Jenny helps her.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: Can we please stop scaring each other now? It’s bad enough we’ve had to grow up in this town.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, you got me. They both plop back down on the couch. The glass doors op behind them.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Wanna watch something else?

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: We can watch the rest of the movie.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: We don’t have to. Neither see the GHOST FACED FIGURE that enters through th sliding glass doors. It slowly makes its way to the couch

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: It’s okay. Now that I’m in the mood.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Are you sure? The GHOST FACE moves closer to the couch. Knife in hand.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: Might as well.  15 Jenny reaches for the remote control. Just as the GHOST F raises the knife.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: You like horror movies. You’re not fooling anybody. As Jenny hits PLAY. The Ghost Face STRIKES with the knife THE SCREEN CUTS TO BLACK. MAIN TITLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning sun shines bright over the quaint town of Woodsboro, California. Little moments of small town life are all around. Picture perfect. Innocent. Quiet. Then-- SIRENS BLARE as SQUAD CARS tear down Main Street, racing, speeding... interrupting any hope of a peaceful day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CELL PHONE VIBRATES across the night stand. PULL BACK t reveal a COUPLE sleeping. Finally, a woman sits up, barel awake. It’s GALE WEATHERS. Or more accurately, GALE RILEY. Ten years later. Still strikingly beautiful. But no longer in that “camera ready” way. She eyes the VIBRATING CELL PHON Looks to her husband. SHOVES HIM.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: You're buzzing. He doesn’t move. It forces Gale to get up. She walks arou to the night stand and takes the cell phone and SILENCES Then, she takes a pillow and SLAMS IT DOWN on the man sleeping beside her. He leaps up. Huh? It’s DEWEY RILEY. All grown up. Still sweet-faced and boyish, but experience has seasoned him. Matured him. Dewey looks around but Gale has already disappeared to th bathroom.  16

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale is at the sink, brushing her teeth. Dewey enters. Silence. He goes to the toilet room. His limp is nearly n existent. Years of physical therapy. Dewey pees. Gale spits. More silence. The unspoken tensio speaks volumes. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: You know what today is, right? Gale nods.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you going? Gale shrugs. Dewey finishes up. Flushes.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think it would be nice if you went. Gale studies herself in the mirror. She’s not the same Ga There’s something missing.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry about last night. I wasn’t in the right space. Dewey finishes up. Flushes.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Wanna talk about it? He turns to his wife. But she’s already left the bathroom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nice two-story house in a nice neighborhood. Dewey exit the house and moves to an SUV in the drive. It has the WOODSBORO SHERIFF’S DECAL on the side. Just th a cute SPORTS CAR SPEEDS down the street. ROCK MUSIC BLARING.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Slow down. Dewey hops in his jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the wheel, KIRBY REED, 17, slows the car.  17

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Shit. Fuck. A cute and quirky girl. Was probably a tomboy until a yea ago. Now, she’s alternative. Or so she wants you to believe. Either way -- she’s cool. She rounds the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neighborhood is lined with houses. Nice lawns, sidewalks, etc. A typical small town neighborhood. Kirby pulls up and parks in front of an old two-story hom Full of character. She TOOTS the horn. A few moments and young girl emerges.

dialogues.speaker: JILL ROBERTS
dialogues.text: A 17 year-old beauty. Pretty in that ingenue way. Smart. Strong. Anda little bit goofy. She makes it sexy. A young girl full of contradictions -- but instantly likable. There’s not a mean bone in her body. She hurries to the car and hops in. INT. KIRBY’S CAR - MORNING Kirby turns the MUSIC DOWN, launches into a huge discussi

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Okay, don’t get upset. Trevor called me last night.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Why is he calling you?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: He knows I have your ear and he wants to work it out. (looks across the street) Where’s Olivia? Kirby HONKS the horn again. Suddenly, OLIVIA MORRIS, 17, emerges from the house directly across the street from Ji house. Olivia is sexy hot. Her walk, style, attitude is fearless and fierce.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What did Trevor have to say?  18

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: He was fishing. He wants to know how upset you are.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What did you tell him?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Epic grief. Not since Bella fucked the werewolf have you known such grief.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (re: Olivia) Can we not talk about this now? The car door opens. Kirby nods. Gets it. But as Olivia crams into the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Okay, so Trevor called me last night. Jill throws her hands up. WTF? Kirby hits the gas and the take off.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: He called both of you? What is he thinking?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: He wants to kiss and make up.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: That’s not going to happen. Just then, LADY GAGA’S TELEPHONE song starts playing. Jil starts digging in her bag, for her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Not Lady Gaga. For god’s sake, change your ringtone. Can we hate her yet? I so wanna hate her. Jill eyes her CALLER ID -- JENNY RANDALL

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Why is Jenny Randall calling me? Both Kirby and Olivia shrug.  19

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I don’t like Jenny Randall. She threw up on me at Tony Marshall’s luau. Jill answers while Olivia explains her hatred.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (into cell) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Hello, Jill.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: (to Olivia) That luau was freshman year.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: (to Kirby) I didn’t say my anger was rational.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (into cell) Jenny? Is this you?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: What’s your favorite scary movie?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Okay, who is this? Olivia and Kirby have taken notice of the call.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: (to Jill) What does she want?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (into cell) Where’s Jenny? Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I asked you a question. What’s your favorite scary movie?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I'm hanging up. CLICK. Jill hangs up. Looks to her friends.  20

dialogues.speaker: JILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That was so weird. I just got a prank phone call from Jenny Randall.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Jenny Randall is weird. Her and her little Marnie the Carny friend are freaks.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: It’s Massacre Week. People go looney, remember? They continue on but Jill is clearly bugged by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning sun shines bright over the quaint town of Woodsboro, California. Little moments of small town life all around. Innocent and simple. Picture-perfect. Except on every lamp post for three blocks -- a GHOST MAS has been placed over the light fixture. Somebody has play a prank. A CITY WORKER stands on a ladder, removing a mask. A fema officer oversees. This is DEPUTY JUDY HICKS, 30’s. Cursed with cute-ness, Hicks plays it serious at all times. She’ over compensating. But it just makes her cuter. The SHERIFF'S JEEP pulls up. Dewey slowly gets out, surveying the stunt.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: Hey, Sheriff. It looks like the celebration has begun. Dewey looks up and down Main Street. Damn.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Damn kids. How'd they get up there?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, you can never get away from this. She smiles, small-town sweet. DEPUTY HICKS (CONT’D) Hey, I made some lemon squares. They’re in my car.  21 Dewey shies away from the idea.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: E-eh, no thanks, Judy.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: (moving closer) Sheriff, you’re not cheating on your wife if you eat my lemon square. Suddenly, Dewey’s RADIO STARTS SQUAWKING.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCHER
dialogues.text: (panicked) Sheriff? Come in, Sheriff. Emergency. Dewey grabs his WALKIE.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCHER
dialogues.text: You need to get to the Randalls’ house on Miller’s Lane. It’s bad, Sheriff, real bad. Dewey looks at Deputy Hicks. Something’s up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small home office. A few PLAQUES on the wall. An award two. Some framed photos of her days from TOP STORY. On shelves are stacks of books. THE WOODSBORO MURDERS. Based on a True Story. A glimpse of the latter sequels. COLLEGE TERROR: THE WOODSBORO HORROR CONTINUES. “Now a Major Motion Picture”. HOLLYWOOD HORROR, The True Story of STAB 3. Etc. Gale sits at her desk, laptop in front of her. CLOSE ON THE COMPUTER SCREEN. The words CHAPTER ONE have been typed a hundred times. Gale takes a sip of coffee. Taps her fingers. The words don’t come. Finally, Gale pulls up GOOGLE on her SCREEN. Types in Sid Prescott -- NEW RESULTS. She DOUBLE CLICKS. A NEWS CLIP STREAMS -- from a local San Francisco talk sh A VIEW FROM THE BAY. Gale presses play. A young FEMALE HO addresses the CAMERA.  22

dialogues.speaker: TV HOST
dialogues.text: What inspired you to write about your life?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY PRESCOTT
dialogues.text: I wanted to tell my story. So much has been written about me in the past...

dialogues.speaker: TV HOST
dialogues.text: And, of course, the movies.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY PRESCOTT
dialogues.text: Yes, with the popularity of the STAB films, I’ve lived my entire adult life in this very public role of victim.

dialogues.speaker: TV HOST
dialogues.text: You survived not one, but three horrific nightmares. I saw the movies when I was a kid. So scary.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY PRESCOTT
dialogues.text: I didn’t want to be defined by the word victim anymore. Writing this book was about letting it go. I wanted to be free of my past and move on once and for all. Sidney looks and sounds great. Full of resilience and inn peace. This is a woman who has weathered a great storm. CLOSE ON GALE as she takes this in. Affected.

dialogues.speaker: TV HOST
dialogues.text: Well, your book put me in tears. It’s such a beautiful and moving story of survival. Everyone should read it. Buy it today, people. OUT OF THE DARK by Sidney Prescott. Sidney laughs at the TV Host’s shameless plug as the Host holds up Sid’s book. Her picture graces the cover.

dialogues.speaker: TV HOST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Congratulations on all the great reviews. What’s next for you?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY PRESCOTT
dialogues.text: Between the book tour and speaking engagements, I’m writing another book. So, we’ll see. It’s alla new adventure.  23 Sidney smiles. Genuinely happy. Gale CLICKS -- Sid disappears. The SCREEN returns to Gale’s own writing. Or lack of. She stares at the words CHAPTER ONE over and ove again. Gale hits delete. Then, leaps up and leaves the room. EXT. JENNY RANDALLS’ HOUSE - DAY The idyllic family home is a murder site. AMBULANCES, SHERIFF’S CARS, COUNTY CORONERS. INT. JENNY RANDALL’S HOUSE - DAY Blood is everywhere. Streaked along the floor and furnitu OFFICERS and TECHNICIANS investigate, dusting for prints, taking photos, bagging evidence. Dewey stands in the living room. His face unflinching. He staring at the sofa where-- Jenny and Marnie’s bloody bodies have been left. On displ Sitting upright, facing the television. Behind the TV -- written in red are the words, “What’s yo favorite scary movie?” A FORENSIC GUY is there inspecting the wall. He’s doing a PHOTO-HANDWRITING ANALYSIS.

dialogues.speaker: FORENSIC GUY
dialogues.text: Common spray paint. First glance, the y’s and e’s are consistent with a right handed male.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Full analysis?

dialogues.speaker: FORENSIC GUY
dialogues.text: Few hours. Lab’s waiting on me. Dewey nods, leaves the room. EXT. FRONT PORCH - JENNY’S HOUSE - DAY Dewey exits the house. Moves to the edge of the porch. Alone, he lets out a DEEP SIGH, letting his true emotions surface. This is hard for him. Just then, Hicks appears, with TWO DEPUTIES behind her. PERKINS, 40’s, seasoned, and HOSS, 20's, eager. Dewey spins around -- not letting his emotions show. He’s the Sheriff. A leader. And he’s good at it.  24

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Hoss, you and Perkins, run the paint. Check all the locals stores and send digital samples to county. Hoss and Perkins take off. They’re on it.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: Jenny Randall’s parents were on a ski trip. They thought Jenny was sleeping at Marnie’s, and Marnie’s folks thought she was at Jenny's.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Phone records?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: Both girls had cells and the one house phone. We’re pulling everything. (beat) You okay, Sheriff? Dewey turns to Hicks. In honest candor.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: This is about the worst thing that could have happened. No, Deputy, I’m not okay. Dewey takes off, leaving Hicks wistful. She feels his pai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red brick and tradition. Establishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STUDENTS come and go. ROBBIE MERCER, 16, a lively, wicked smart cool-nerd, move through the hallway with a FLIP CAM He stops Olivia at her locker.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: This is HALL PASS WITH ROBBIE, coming at ya, POV. I’m here with the luscious Olivia-don’t-look-at- my-breasts-—I-have-a-mind--Morris, with our topic of the week.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Which is? Hurry up.  25

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: For all my horror ho’s out there on the anniversary of the Woodsboro Massacre, I have to ask: What’s your favorite scary movie?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: That’s all you got? Some lame ass douche question? “What’s your favorite scary movie?” Go away, closet boy. Just then, CHARLIE WALKER, 17, messy cute, pops into fram

dialogues.speaker: THE EXORCIST, PSYCHO, THE SHINING
dialogues.text: and anything starring Nicole Kidman’s new face. Owwww.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: Worst scary movie?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: An exhaustive list, Robbie, but I'll go with the entire career of M. Night Shyamalan. Just then, Kirby appears, having heard this.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: No way, THE SIXTH SENSE is epic.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Revoked. Now considered a fluke. No longer valid.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE HALL
dialogues.text: Jill is at her locker, finishing up. She closes it, turns and runs into... TREVOR SHELDON, 17, high school jock. Perfectly handsome. Perfectly cocky.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Hey, Jill, how ya doing? Jill barely acknowledges him. Just an awkward gaze.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you ever going to talk to me again?  26

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I hadn't planned on it. She starts by him, but he cuts her off.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: C’mon, you're not being fair. I deserve a chance to tell you what happened.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Is it different from the facts? Because I know what happened. Jill start off -- but Trevor blocks her path. This just makes her angry.

dialogues.speaker: JILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And trying to use Kirby and Olivia to help your case -- bad move. Jill pushes passed him, but he grabs her arm, pulling her back. It takes her by surprise.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Please, Jill, just talk to me. Trevor tries to connect to her eyes -- he’s pleading. She pulls her arm away when--

dialogues.speaker: MR. BAKER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Is everything okay here? They both turn to find MR. BAKER, 30's, studious, no-nons type, standing behind them. Beat. Jill looks to Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Yeah, Mr. Baker, we’re good. Jill turns and walks off. Trevor cuts eyes at Mr. Baker.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BAKER
dialogues.text: Yes, Trevor, what?

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Nothing. Trevor starts off, but this time Mr. Baker blocks his pat He points in the other direction. Opposite of Jill.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BAKER
dialogues.text: You go that way.  27 Trevor wants to kill this teacher. But he plays it cool. Turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car pulls up and parks on the street. Gale gets out. Sh stares at the small book store on the corner. She walks over to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale looks in the window. Sidney’s book is the only book display. A sign reads MEET SIDNEY PRESCOTT. TODAY ONLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small book and old fashioned book store. It’s crowded. At capacity. Standing room only. At a lectern, stands Sidney Prescott, reading from her bo

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I was playing the role of victim. The only problem? I never auditioned for the role. I never asked for the part, but here I was playing it to the hilt. Sidney Prescott, the real life Scream Queen. Celebrity victim. It wasn’t who I set out to be. It wasn’t the life I wanted. In the back, Gale sneaks in, finds a spot. She listens to Sidney who is full of quiet strength and honesty.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was clear my life was in need of a rewrite, a re-imagining. I had to create a new part to play. So, I sat down and began to write a new life for myself. A life that accepted my past but was no longer imprisoned by it. APPLAUSE from the room. CLOSE ON GALE -- annoyed and cynical, but oddly moved too. ON SIDNEY as she greets the PEOPLE who gather around. A YOUNG WOMAN, REBECCA REED, 20's, a poised and polished power assistant keeps the wheels moving.  28

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: We're going to begin the book signing in just a few minutes. Sidney eyes a woman, mid-forties, KATE ROBERTS, who is waiting to see her. A big smile and hug.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Aunt Kate, you made it. How are you? How’s Jill?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: We're good. You'll see her at dinner. It’s been too long.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Yes, it has. I know since Dad’s funeral, I’ve been bad with the phone calls.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You're here now. We’1ll have a good time tonight. Rebecca steps in -- not subtle at all.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: We gotta keep it moving. Kate gives a wink, taking off. “Seeya tonight.” As Sidney turns and comes face to face with Gale. Beat. Rebecca sees them together. She motions to a PHOTOGRAPHER hand. “Get this.” The Photographer instantly starts SNAPPING PHOTOS. Sidney refuses to let it be awkward. She hugs Gale.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: It’s good to see you, Gale. I was hoping you would come.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Sidney. I haven't read it yet...

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I know where you can get a copy. A lingering moment between these two women. Sidney senses something different about Gale. Just then, Dewey enters a Sidney lights up.  29

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dewey! Gale watches as Sidney races to him, hugging him. Old friends. Only when they break, does Sidney see Dewey’s serious and worried expression. Dewey turns to Gale. Who instantly reads him. Something i very, very wrong. And as if on cue -- COMMOTION ERUPTS all around. PEOPLE point to the store windows. To the CARS and NEWS VANS see approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The quiet and peaceful town explodes into chaos as the NE MEDIA descends on Main Street. News of the murders is out INT. CLASSROOM — DAY Mr. Baker is in the middle of class. He writes on the cha board with his right hand.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BAKER
dialogues.text: Don’t forget, projects, are due Thursday. CELL PHONES start to go off in class. VIBRATING everywher STUDENTS start texting each other. The news is spreading.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BAKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Somebody wanna share? Suddenly -- LOUD COMMOTION OUTSIDE. MEDIA TRUCKS are screeching up. Distracted, the KIDS all look to the windo Even Mr. Baker is intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BAKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the...? Robbie reads his iphone.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: Jenny Randall and Marnie Cooper were murdered last night. The room erupts in SHOCK. Jill turns to Kirby. What? Then the BELL RINGS. Quickly, the class empties out. The news taking everyone’s attention. Jill and Kirby start out.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Who called you this morning?  30

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I don’t know. But it came from Jenny’s phone.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: This just got creepy. They exit the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the lawn, TV CAMERAMEN hop out and jockey for position TV REPORTERS are quickly starting stand-ups:

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: ...the murdered girls were students here, at Woodsboro High School...

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: ...this week marks the 15 year anniversary of the infamous Woodsboro Murders...

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: +..as recounted in the bestseller by Gale Weathers which launched the horror franchise STAB... A CROWD has gathered to watch. Shocked. Olivia sees Kirby and Jill exit the school. She races over.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Do you believe this? Didn’t Jenny call you this morning? A look of dread has washed over Jill’s face. And, as if o cue -- Lady Gaga’s TELEPHONE starts playing. Jill reaches into her bag and withdraws her phone. She looks at the CALLER ID. It reads JENNY RANDALL. Jill nearly GASPS. She looks to her friends. All three of them are freaking out. Beat. Finally, Jill answers it. Silence

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Jill.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I pick you.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What?  31 Kirby grabs Jill’s phone, puts it on SPEAKER.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I pick you. Don’t disappoint me. CLICK. The phone goes dead. The three girls look at each other. Stunned. Terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bull pen. Surrounded by offices. A FLURRY of activity. As DEPUTIES come and go. A chaotic atmosphere. Gale moves through the bull pen. She looks around. Sees Deputy Hicks.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Deputy Judy, where’s Dewey? Deputy Hicks looks a bit put out. She’s not a big fan of Dewey's wife. But she’s professional about it.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: He’s conducting an interview at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: With Sidney Prescott? Are they in the conference room? I/’11 just head back. Gale starts towards the back corridor, but Hicks blocks h

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: You can’t go back there, Gale.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Since when? I’m married to the Sheriff, I’m part of the team. Gale starts for the hallway again. But Hicks means busine

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: It’s a murder investigation. I’m sorry. Gale’s instinct is to rip Hicks’ head off, but lets it go Decides to play the “good wife”. But she’s annoyed.  32

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill sits at the conference table with Dewey. Her mother, Kate, is next to her, supportive. Along with Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: “I pick you.”

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: That’s what he said.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What does it mean, Dewey?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: I can’t answer that yet.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Am I in danger, Sheriff?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: To be honest, we don’t have enough to go on at the moment. Dewey's eyes meet Sidney. Who appears strong and composed She squeezes Jill’s hand, reassuringly.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: No, you’re not. Because we’re not going to let anything happen to you, Jill. Jill looks at them, trying to stay calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale pours a cup of coffee, waiting, when she sees... Sidney’s assistant, Rebecca, who has taken over a desk. S has her iPad out, Blackberry in hand, and headset in her

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (on phone, compassionate) No comment beyond Miss Prescott’s sincere condolences to the victim's family and friends. Thank you. (next call) This is Rebecca. (instantly ecstatic) OHMYFUCKINGGOD, Henry. Two girls were butchered. Payday. And I was so not feeling Woodsboro. I was like lame PR move, right? Well, FUCKMEWOW. Best. Idea. Ever.  33 Rebecca spots Gale watching her. Gives a wave.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Henry, I’11 call you back. Rebecca clicks off. Goes to Gale. In awe.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have to geek out. I didn’t get a chance earlier. It’s an honor to meet you. When I was a kid, it was all about, “TOP STORY with Gale Weathers.” You were my 90's.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: It’s Gale Riley now.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Aw. And you gave it all up for love. I bow down. That is so... not me. Gale’s not sure she likes this girl. She’s not a bitch. Just talky and self-involved.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: So you're Sidney’s assistant?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I’m covering the book tour for Random. So, yes, I am assisting Sidney, but I wear a lot of hats so if you need anything. Rebecca slides Gale her business card. Gale takes it. Hmm

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How long have you and Dewey been married?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Almost ten years ago.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Aw. So it was just like your characters in STAB 3. Wow.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Yeah, wow.  34

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I didn’t mean bad wow. It just always seemed like more of a movie romance than a real one because it was a movie and in real life you two would never be... (catches herself) Ooh, don’t wanna dig that hole, so, how many kids do you have? Gale stares at her, blankly. As the hole gets deeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several MEDIA OUTLETS have planted themselves outside the POLICE STATION. Olivia and Kirby watch the ruckus from th water fountain. Charlie is there too.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: I don’t understand why the killer called Jill?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: She’s been tapped. She’s related to Sidney. It makes it personal.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It puts Jill up next on the victim chain. If the killer calls, you're dead, that’s the rule.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: An overused, done to death rule.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You can blame techno J-horror.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: (explains) THE RING, GRUDGE, ONE MISSED CALL. Charlie and Kirby talk in a language that is foreign to Olivia.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Someone's gotta bite it. You can’t kill Sidney. She’s victim royalty, she can’t die.  35

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Sure she can. Her character has been gone since STAB 3 anyway.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Too dicey. Potential backlash.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Laurie Strode bit it in HALLOWEEN 8, Ripley died in ALIEN 4. There’s precedence. Olivia is completely confused by their conversation.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: What are you guys talking about?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (duh) STAB. Someone’s gonna make a sequel outta this. “STAB 8: RETURN TO WOODSBORO.” Charlie breaks out with the HALLOWEEN score while Kirby mimics FRIDAY THE 13TH.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE KIRBY
dialogues.text: Da-DA-da-DA-da-da... Ki-ki-ki-ma-ma-ma...

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: This is real. This isn’t a movie.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: But it will be. And that Charlie and Kirby are certain of. INT. SHERIFF’S OFFICE - DAY Deputy Hicks fills Dewey in on her findings.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: The cyber team is running a full surveillance on the cell phones. As soon as we get something--

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: I want round the clock watch on Jill and Sidney. Use Hoss and Perkins.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: Any statement to the press?  36

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: No comment. Hicks nods. Sees the strain on her boss’ face.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: We'll get through this, Dewey. She gives him a supportive smile. Just then, Gale plows i his office. Hicks starts to object but Dewey allows it.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: It’s okay. Judy exits, trying to hide her disdain. Beat. As Dewey ey Gale. A long, strained look. This is hard on him.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Do you have a suspect?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: We don’t have enough as this point.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Yea, but we’ve been down this road before. It’s a certain type of killer that’s attracted to Sidney Prescott. It shouldn’t be too hard to find a horror movie freak with a motive and a cell phone. Dewey stares at her in amazement. She stares back. What?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: You’re excited about this.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: I’m trying to be proactive before someone else is killed.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: No, you're really excited about this.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: I had a cup of coffee. What?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: This is an official murder investigation. You can’t be a part of it.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: I’m not a reporter anymore.  37

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: You're not a cop either, Gale. Beat. This hits Gale hard. It’s impact speaks to a much bigger problem. Dewey’s look is apologetic, but he’s also very busy.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I’ve got work to do. He exits, hurriedly. Leaving Gale floored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PATROL CAR is parked in front of the house. INT. FOYER - ROBERT’S HOUSE - NIGHT A large, old home. Not a lot of money. But comfortable. Hoss is moving from room to room, checking it out. Perkin can be seen going up the stairs. Detective Hicks can be seen in the kitchen with Kate. They're doing an official house, “Clear.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perkins checks out the guest room. He looks in the closet checks the windows. Secures them. The bedroom faces the front of the house. His eyes scan the front yard and stre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca and Sidney are in the living room with their lugg

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I had reservations at the Doubletree.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: It'll be better here. All of us in numbers. We’1l be safer. Rebecca is resigned to make the most of it.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: As long as we’re in Seattle by Tuesday. So what’s the deal with your Aunt? Where’s Jill’s dad?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Aunt Kate is my mother’s kid sister. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're pretty much my only family now. And the father’s not in the picture, so don’t ask. Rebecca nods. Got it. Just then, Jill enters.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t get over how grown up you are. What’s it been five years?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: It was the body morphing years.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: It’s good to see you. Even though... Jill nods. Gets the sentiment. She feels the same way. A KNOCK at the door. In seconds -- ALL THREE DEPUTIES SWARM TO THE FRONT DOOR. Sidney and Ji do a double-take. Impressive. INT. FOYER - ROBERT’S HOUSE - NIGHT Hicks opens the door to reveal Dewey -- eyeing his wrist watch.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: I'm impressed. Hicks smiles. Charmed by his boyish test. He enters. Look to Jill and Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I found a girl loitering outside.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Step aside, Sheriff. Kirby appears with take-out food.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fried fat. Who’s with me? She enters. Jill's happy to see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Jill are preparing take-out while Rebecca pours wine, all chatty.  39

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I was gonna cook. I do know how. Thank you, hon. Kate takes a glass of wine. Drinks.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: This smells yummie.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Oh good, you eat real food, I was worried. Jill looks to the family room where Dewey and Sidney are sitting on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney and Dewey sit on the couch and catch up.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: It’s a 30 city tour. Barnes & Nobles, Seattle is next up. It’s not easy to generate interest in inspirational self-help.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: You have the STAB audience.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: That audience doesn’t read books. Shocker. Rebecca interrupts with wine. Dewey sets his glass down o the coffee table. He’s “on duty”. Rebecca returns to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: How have you been?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: You're very calm for what’s going on around you.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I can’t control what other people do. Now, how are you? How’s Gale? Sidney is positive and friendly. Dewey finds it disarming

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: I’m good and Gale is... well, it’s been a little rocky lately.  He shrugs. 40

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry to hear that.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: She's not working and I don’t think she knows who she is if she’s not working.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Why isn’t she?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: She was tabloid TV. The internet killed a lot of that. She hosted that True Crime cable show for a while but... it was canceled.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Isn't she writing another book? Sidney gets it. Feels for her friend.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gale's smart, she'll figure it out. Dewey nods. Hopeful. He stares at Sid. Impressed. She leans

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: You sure did. You really got it together. in -- whispers.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I’m scared shitless. Ssh.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: That makes more sense. (then) It’s really nice to see you, Sid. Sid smiles. She’s happy to see him too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light breeze. Leaves blow across the lawn. Hoss can be seen sitting in a car, parked in front. Dewey exits the house and moves down the walk to his JEEP He waves at Deputy Hoss.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Eyes up, Hoss.  4l Hoss waves back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is brushing her teeth. She spits, rinses, exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney moves down the hallway -- at the end is a door, slightly ajar. Sid peaks in to reveal. Rebecca is sleeping with her ear buds in -- her iPod layi across her chest. Sid quietly closes the door, turns and RUNS SMACK into DEPUTY HICKS. Sid JUMPS.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. I was just making my rounds.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: No, it’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: Dewey left. He’s on cell if you need him. I’ve got Perkins in the back and Hoss in front. Just shout.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Thanks. Sid starts to her room when--

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: You don’t remember me, do ya? We went to high school together. Judy Hicks. We had the same home room. Sidney studies her a moment, tries to recall. DEPUTY HICKS (CONT’D) And Drama Club, too. We were in Peter Pan together. I played a lost boy... you were Tiger Lily. Sidney smiles politely. She still doesn’t remember. Deput Hicks tries to hide her disappointment. DEPUTY HICKS (CONT’D) It’s okay. You had a lot of stuff going on back then. And, well, I guess I wasn’t very memorable. Awkward. Then...  42

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: It’s nice to see you again, Judy. Sid disappears down the hall. Hicks stares after her. Bummed. And just a little irked too. INT. JILL’S BEDROOM - NIGHT CLOSE ON THE TV SCREEN -- where two appropriate D-LIST ST have sex. The phone RINGS. Bad acting ensues.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I don’t wanna watch this. It’s in poor taste.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Were you BFF’s with Jenny or Marnie? I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: That's not the point.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: It’s cathartic, we’re de- sensitizing our grief. ON TV -- THE D-LIST ACTRESS SCREAMS as she’s STABBED. A KNOCK at the door. Both GIRLS jump. Kirby hits PAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Come in. The door opens -- it’s Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: You guys doing okay in here? Sidney looks to the TV. Sees the STAB movie on PAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: We were just... when in Rome.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Is this the one where Amy Poehler is the killer?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Well, it’s Heidi Klum first, then after the plastic surgery goes wrong, it’s Amy Poehler. She kills all the skinny girls from the CW.  43

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Right. Well, good-night. Sid’s cool about. She exits, closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (idiot) “When in Rome?”

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: I’m star-struck. DATELINE did a whole hour on her once. I watched it five times. She’s the shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney enters the guest bedroom. She goes to her open sui case and finds lotion. She hops up on the bed and gets comfortable. INT. JILL’S BEDROOM - ROBERTS HOUSE - NIGHT Kirby’s CELL PHONE RINGS. She looks at the CALLER ID: OLIVIA.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: (answers ) Yes, Olivia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia's car pulls up in her driveway across the street.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: (into her cell) Is that your car? Are you at Jill's? Kirby jumps up, looks out the window. Sees Olivia getting out of her car across the street. They wave. Olivia moves up the walk to her house. It’s dark inside.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Great. My mom’s not home yet. Let me speak to Jill. Kirby hands Jill the phone.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: She wants to speak to you. Jill takes the phone.  44

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: How are you? Did I miss anything?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Nope. I’m okay.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: I'll be over in a few. I saw Trevor at practice tonight.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What was he doing there? Olivia enters her house. CLICKS on a light. Locks the doo

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Picking up his equipment. He’s done. They kicked him off the team.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Did he tell you about A&M? He lost the scholarship too. Jill pauses. She didn’t know that.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The guy’s ruined. All for smoking a joint in the Locker Room.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: It was the Girl’s Locker Room.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: I know, I know... Just then, Jill’s CELL PHONE RINGS. Kirby eyes it on the night stand. READS the CALLER ID: CHARLIE.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: It’s Charlie. (answers it) What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (from phone) Hello, Jill?  45 It’s not Charlie -- it’s the voice of Ghost Face.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Nope, it’s Kirby. Why are you doing this, Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I’m not Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: What are you doing with Charlie's phone. Huh? Mr. Ghost Face? (to Jill) It’s Charlie being an asshole. Jill waves it away. She can’t deal with him now. She goes back to Olivia.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Do you think he fooled around with Jessica?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Shotgun make-out, yes. Full on blow job, doubt it. Jill nods. She completely agrees.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (to Kirby) I want to talk to Jill.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: (to Man) She doesn’t want to talk to you. IN OLIVIA'S BEDROOM - She’s changing into sweats.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Then again, Jessica’s a little hoochie le-whore.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: C'mon, Ghost Face, talk to me. Aren’t you supposed to ask me a question. Go ahead, horror quiz me, Cuz’, you know Charlie -- you can’t stump me.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: How’s the movie?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: What movie?  46 Kirby stops. Goes silent.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: How do you know we’re watching that?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Because I’m standing in the closet. Kirby spins around to Jill’s closed closet door.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Stop. You are not. Jill sees Kirby staring at her closet door.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (to Kirby) What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: (to Jill) Charlie’s being a dick.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Then who the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Open the closet door.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: You do know there’s cops all over this house.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I think I’d have just enough time to slice someone open. Beat. Kirby grows cautious. Chilled.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (to Kirby) Are you still talking to Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: (on cell to Jill) What’s going on over there?  47

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (to Olivia) Kirby is being weird. Kirby stares at the closet. She’s hesitating.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: (to man) There’s no way you’re in there. Kirby reaches for the door knob. Her hand shakes some.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (to Kirby) What are you doing? Suddenly, she RIPS THE CLOSET DOOR OPEN. It’s empty. Reli floods Kirby's face.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: (to man) Liar. I’m over this.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I never said I was in your closet. SMASH CUT TO OLIVIA’S BEDROOM Olivia is still on the phone with Jill when... A GHOST FACED FIGURE EXPLODES FROM HER CLOSET. Surprised and stunned -- she barely has time to react whe the GHOST FACE is upon her. BACK IN JILL’S BEDROOM Both Jill and Kirby HEAR OLIVIA SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Olivia? Olivia?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: What’s happening? They turn to each other. Olivia can be heard SCREAMING fr both of their phones. IN OLIVIA’S BEDROOM A LARGE BUTCHER KNIFE STRIKES. It tears into Olivia’s arm slicing her flesh. She SCREAMS and TUMBLES backwards. The cell phone hits the floor.  48 ON JILL AND KIRBY -- Confused. Crazed. They race to the window and look across the street. They can make out a struggle, a Ghost Face... but then the light goes out.

dialogues.speaker: JILL KIRBY
dialogues.text: Olivia... what’s happening? Olivia? Nooo... Olivia? IN SIDNEY’S BEDROOM Sidney HEARS SCREAMING. She bolts from her bed.

dialogues.speaker: ON OLIVIA
dialogues.text: As she tries in vain to flee. But the Ghost Face cuts her off, SMASHING into her. She goes CRASHING to the floor. S crawls to her knees and tries again. The GHOST FACE is upon her again. KNIFE RAISED. Olivia CRIES OUT -- one last blood curdling SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Nooooo!!! CLICK. Both lines go dead. A moment of frozen horror. Both girls are SCREAMING IN TERROR when Sidney comes raci into the room. They point to the window. Sidney goes to the window.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: The house -- Olivia! SIDNEY’S POV - The house is now dark. Suddenly, a FLASHIN LIGHT takes her eye. IT COMES FROM OLIVIA’S UPSTAIRS BEDROOM. CLOSE ON SIDNEY’S FACE -- OVERCOME WITH HORROR As she stares into Olivia’s bedroom window to see a GHOST FACED FIGURE holding Olivia by the neck. She’s still aliv terrified, hurt, whimpering -- but alive.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Nooooo... Sidney watches as the GHOST FACE picks up the LARGE KNIFE Then, turns to the window and stares back at Sidney -- taunting her. Sidney SCREAMS. Beats the window. God... No... She jumps into action. She bolts from the bedroom. Running, racing, nearly falling down the stairs...  49

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get the police... She SCREAMS BLOODY MURDER. But she wastes no time stoppin She RIPS OPEN THE FRONT DOOR and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid bolts out of the house, running across the street, SCREAMING HER LUNGS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: He’s killing her! Where are you? She sees the DEPUTY’S PATROL CAR. Goes to it. But no sign of Deputy Hicks or anyone. She BEATS on the hood.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are you, people? Goddammit! Jill and Kirby come racing out of the house after Sidney. She SCREAMS at them.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Call the police. Now. She runs, bare foot, across the street. Kirby goes racing back inside the house while Jill debates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid races up the drive, to the front door. IT’S LOCKED. S goes to the window next to it. She picks up a POTTED PLAN and throws it through. GLASS SHATTERS. Sidney climbs in after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney can’t be stopped. She races through the living roo Her feet bloody from broken glass. She climbs the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS LANDING
dialogues.text: It’s dark. Sidney sees a light through a door. She bursts through it to find... OLIVIA'S BODY on the bed -- propped up against the headbo Her stomach ripped open. Her insides exposed. BLOOD EVERYWHERE. She's too late. The sight overwhelms Sid. She erupts into tears. Her knees fail her. She clutches the door to keep from falling. Then, a PHONE RINGS.  50 Sid turns to find a CELL PHONE sitting on the dresser -- if waiting for her. She picks it up, brings it to her ear A long silence. And then...

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (from phone) Welcome home, Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Nooooo...

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I’ve missed you. Sidney is defiant. She SCREAMS in anger.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: It’s time for another movie. I’ve been waiting.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Only one more, Sid. It’1l be your last one. I promise. STAB. The Death of Sidney Prescott. Based on a true story. It’1ll be the best one yet. CLICK. The PHONE goes DEAD. A NOISE BEHIND HER. Sid spins around to see... Jill racing up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Don’t come up here. But Jill doesn’t stop. She gets to the top of the stairca Sid goes to her -- to block her from seeing Olivia's body

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: No, please... Is she?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... Just as Sidney goes to Jill-- GHOST FACE LUNGES FROM THE HALL CLOSET -- KNIFE RAISED.  51 He BARRELS into Sidney -- but she’s fast -- she spins aro and KNOCKS him against the wall. As Jill races to help, t GHOST FACE turns on her -- KNIFE RAISED. Sidney LUNGES at him. The KNIFE STRIKES JILL IN THE ARM - slices open her shirt -- as Sidney and the GHOST FACE go TUMBLING down the stairs. Together -- intertwined. They hit the base of the stairs. Hard. The GHOST FACE instantly rises. But, Sid is disoriented. She tries to crawl away but GHOST FACE pulls her back when... Sidney KICKS the GHOST FACE off of her -- she scrambles t her feet, racing to the door, coming face to face with. DEPUTY HOSS AND DEPUTY PERKINS -- their guns drawn on her She turns around to discover -- GHOST FACE has disappeare Deputy Hoss takes off in pursuit while Deputy Perkins goe Sidney. He tries to help her -- but she pushes him away.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where were you? Sidney is upset and angry. She sees Jill coming down the stairs, clutching a bleeding arm. Sid races to her. Sidne turns to Deputy Perkins.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Help me with her. Perkins springs into action, aiding Jill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crime scene chaos. SQUAD CARS, AMBULANCE, CORONER'S VAN,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AMBULANCE SPEEDS away, revealing Dewey. He eyes Hicks with Perkins and Hoss -- marches over. They instantly sta defending themselves.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY PERKINS
dialogues.text: I saw someone in the Ghost costume. He went in the alley.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HOSS
dialogues.text: I saw him too, Sheriff.  52

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: And they radioed and I circled around to cut him off.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: While the killer circled back to the girl’s house.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY PERKINS
dialogues.text: He got us with the other house, Sheriff. The Deputies know they screwed up. Big time. Just then, t CORONER and his TEAM carry Olivia’s body out of the house The sight weighs heavily on Dewey.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: A small town hospital. The MEDIA has descended upon the m steps. CAMERAS and REPORTERS everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flurry of activity. Whirls around Sidney and Jill. NURSES, MEDICS, DOCTORS... They're being treated side by side. Jill sits reclined in bed, as DOCTOR ORTH, 38, handsome and confident, bandages wound. She WINCES. Kate is there -- quietly panicked.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: You didn’t hear us screaming?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Two glasses of wine and an Ambien. I didn’t hear anything. Just then, Kirby comes racing in.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: They told me it was a surface wound. Surface wounds are okay. They hug.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Ow. Surface wounds hurt.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: (to a nurse) Oxycotin stat.  53 Dr. Orth goes to Sidney, one bed over. An INTERN removes small bits of glass from her feet. Dr. Orth inspects it. With his right hand, he checks an abrasion on her foot.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ORTH
dialogues.text: It’s not bad, believe or not. How’s the head?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Massive hangover. The doctor holds her stare too long. Sidney senses it.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did we go to school together?

dialogues.speaker: DR. ORTH
dialogues.text: You went to school with my younger brother, Steve. You may not remember, but he was...

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Steven Orth. Yes, of course, I do. And he had a brother, Danny, who was in med school. He’s taken aback. Surprised, she remembers.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ORTH
dialogues.text: Most people forget about Steve. The guy tied to the chair in the back yard, killed off in the opening scene. Generic victim #1. Not even part of the story. The doctor clearly has some residual feelings. Over his shoulder, Gale approaches. Excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Dewey called me. I came. Whatever I can do.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: You can help me find Rebecca. (to nurse) Have you seen my assistant? Sidney hops off the bed, WINCING as her feet hit the floo She slips into her shoes, not stopping. She’s leaving and very determined about it.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Dewey said you talked to the killer? What did he say?  54

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: He told me to leave town as quickly as possible.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: He did?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: He said the next STAB movie was about the death of Sidney Prescott. I interpret that as: Get the hell out of town now. Sidney sees a weary Rebecca entering. She’s shell-shocked

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Good. You’re okay. Cuz’ there’s tons of press requests...

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: We're leaving tonight. We’1l drive to Oakland and fly standby. Where’s the rental?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: In the lot. There’s a lot of press out there. Let me pull the car up. I’1l text you. Rebecca takes off -- grateful to be leaving. Gale watches Sidney collects her things.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Leaving may not be the best thing to do, Sidney. Sidney looks at her. Jill and Kirby take notice. As does Dr. Orth.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: You're kidding me, right? I came back here and people are dead.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: How were you supposed to know some psycho was planning a sequel?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: You'd like that wouldn't you, Gale?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Excuse me?  55

dialogues.speaker: JILL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you leaving, Sidney? Sidney turns to see Jill. Sid goes to her full of compassion.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Someone is out there killing people because I’m here. I have to go before someone else gets hurt. Beat. Sadly, this makes sense to Jill. To all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PRESS is having a field day with the news of another murder. Amongst the CROWD is Trevor. Watching.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Another young girl is dead tonight and Woodsboro is once again the setting for a real life horror movie... Rebecca emerges from the hospital. She hides behind TWO SECURITY GUARDS trying to figure out the best way to mane the crowd when Dewey comes barreling through. The REPORTERS swarm him as he makes his way to the doors. Rebecca uses this as her opportunity to flee. She darts through the crowd. Unnoticed. “Sheriff.” “A statement.” “Anything.” The Sheriff reaches the top of the stairs and turns to the CAMERAS as microph are shoved in his face.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: I can assure you that we are doing everything we can to apprehend those responsible.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: So you think there’s more than one killer?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: We can’t rule it out yet. Reporters continue to grill him.  56

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dimly lit lot. Rows and rows of parked cars. Rebecca appears moving through them. She looks around, unable to remember where the rental is parked. She presses keys. BEEP. The RENTAL CAR’S LIGHTS FLASH two rows over. She starts for it when her CELL PHONE RINGS. S digs into her bag. Pulls it out with her ear piece. It’s marked BLOCKED CALLED. She answers, inserting her bluetooth ear piece.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (into cell) This is Rebecca.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (but not so obvious) Sidney Prescott please?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: This is her assistant, Rebecca Walters. Can I take a message?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Yes, please? Rebecca starts to dig in her bag for a pen and paper.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Okay, sure, um... (thinks better of it) Actually, this is a really bad time. May I call you back? Rebecca crosses to the car. She regrets picking up the phone. So not the time for this shit.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: It’s really important. It will just take a second.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Please tell Sidney that it’s very important that she doesn’t -- are you writing this down?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Yes, I am.  57 Rebecca’s not writing shit. She’s lying.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Are you sure? It sounds like you're walking.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I’m writing. Who is this? Rebecca arrives at the rental car. BEEPS the door. Opens and slides in.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Please let Sidney know it’s imperative that she not leave town and to illustrate this I’m going to kill her assistant.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Excuse me...? CLICK. The phone goes dead. It takes a second for this to register. Horror fills Rebecca's face. She LOCKS the car doors, STARTS the ENGINE. Looks to the left and right then spins around and peers into the back seat. It’s empty. She turns back when--

dialogues.speaker: THROAT.
dialogues.text: Rebecca’s SCREAM is cut short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is still with Gale and Jill. Aunt Kate and Kirby a there too. Then-- Sid's CELL PHONE RINGS. The CALLER ID says Rebecca. She picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Bec? Are you out front?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Yes, Sidney, you'll find Rebecca right out front. Sidney face falls. Noooooo. She takes off running. Gale and the others follow.  58

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey continues to answer reporter’s questions at the hospital’s entrance.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: The police department is working around the clock to make sure no one else is hurt. Behind the CROWD OF REPORTERS, Rebecca’s rental car can b seen drifting down the road. Coasting. Building speed on the road’s incline. Growing closer and closer -- headed directly for the CROWD. Finally, people start to notice. “Watch out.” The car is headed right for the hospital’s entrance. Dewey sees it.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guys, watch it, move aside. Instant commotion. As the car parts the CROWD. Sidney and the others emerge from the hospital as-- The car CRASHES into a MEDIA VAN. Through the busted side window -- Rebecca’s lifeless body can be seen behind the wheel. Her throat slashed. Horrific SCREAMS from all around. As the CAMERAS film eve second of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A waiting room has been taken over by the police. Jill si on a couch -- Kirby is curled up asleep, next to her. Aun Kate is there too.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: How's your arm?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: It’s okay. Sore. Gale passes with coffee. She takes a seat next to Sidney. Offers her a coffee. Sid takes it.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Rebecca’s family has been notified. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I never should have come back here.  59

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: This isn’t your fault, Sid. If anything it’s mine. I wrote the book, I sold the movie rights. I started this. Sidney looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: You're right. It is your fault. But I knew better. (then) Now, I can’t leave. We have to keep her safe. Sidney is referring to Jill.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: We will.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I don’t care what happens to me. But no one else can get hurt. Sidney is absolute and determined. Gale nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey is with Deputy Hicks.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: The Cyber team is working on triangulating the cell phones. We should have something soon. Gale marches up, determined.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Anything at all?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
