dialogues.text: We’re on it, Gale.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Don’t do that. Don’t cut me out of this. I’m a part of this.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: It’s not protocol, Gale, for the Sheriff's wife to be involved-- Gale spins around -- ready to rip Hicks’ throat out.  60

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: And who is talking to Deputy Judy? Not me. Dewey jumps in between them. Ushers Gale off to the side.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Okay, you can help. Just be nice. Gale looks at Dewey, very seriously. Very troubled.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: We have to stop this, Dewey, before anyone else dies. He nods. In total agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over the majestic rolling hills of a beauti Northern California landscape. Quiet. Tranquil. INT. JILL’S BEDROOM - ROBERTS HOUSE - MORNING The sun shines through the window. Illuminating Jill in b Her eyes flutter open. She awakens. YAWNS. She gets up and peers out the window. Sees HOSS and PERKI below -- standing guard. Alert and ready. A GROUP OF REPORTERS camp out too. Then, across the stree

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Covered in police tape. Now, a crime scene. A quiet momen As Jill truly awakens to the nightmare she’s living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is drinking coffee, while talking on her cell.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: (into cell) I’m staying. I'd prefer if everything could be channeled through your office. Thank you, Henry, I appreciate that. I’11 let you know more as I know it. Bye. Sid hangs up as Jill enters the kitchen. Sid goes straigh for her and hugs her. It’s comforting to Jill.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry about Olivia.  61 Jill tears up.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know when people say, “I know how you feel,” but you know they’re just saying that and have no friggin’ clue how you feel? (then) I know how you feel. Sidney’s look says it all. She does know. Jill appreciate it, finding comfort in Sidney’s quiet strength.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Where’s mom?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: She stopped by work for a bit.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I saw all the reporters outside.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: That's why we’re inside. Sid hands Jill a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: How do you deal with it? With everything that’s happened to you? You've seen so much...

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Death? (a moment) It sucks. I hate my life. I didn’t ask for it. But running from it gets me nowhere. I’ve learned to embrace it.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: How did you do that? Sidney shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I wrote a book about grief and guilt and hope.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: And it helped?  62

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: It helped... pay the bills. The thing that helped most, which I worded differently in the book, is I finally said, “Fuck it.” This is it. Your life. You can boo-hoo or get on with it. I’ve earned the right to say, “Fuck it.” So I did. Sid is very frank. Jill appreciates it. She likes this si of Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I didn’t know you had edge.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: (poised) I’m so polite, aren't I? Things are never what they seem, Jill. That I can assure you.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I don’t think I'd like the attention. People staring at me.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: People stare at me? As if she didn’t know. Sidney smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I won’t lie. I’d love to disappear. Be somebody else. Start from scratch. No scars. But that’s not reality. Jill smiles. In adoration. She looks up to Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHERIFF’S JEEP and TWO PATROL CARS are parked in fron Dewey and Gale are there with Deputy Hicks and SEVERAL OT DEPUTIES. A brainy technician, TONY, 30, holds open a laptop.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I triangulated the cell phones. The one used to call Jenny Randall, Jenny Randall’s cell that was used to call Jill Roberts and now Charlie Walker’s cell. Tony points to the laptop.  63 ON LAPTOP SCREEN -- A digital map of Woodsboro. Several CLICKS and it ZOOMS to the school. THREE BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See the signal strength? Those phones are here. On this campus.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: What’s the accuracy?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: The Lab’s GPS can get within 300 feet. Gale takes the lead.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Great, you guys find the phones. Dewey and I will begin questioning suspects. They all stare at Gale. Especially Dewey.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: (annoyed) What are you doing? Do you see this? It’s a badge. My badge. Where’s yours? Oh, right, you don’t have one.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: You said I could come.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: I said you could observe.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Consult.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Quietly. Hicks and the others watch their marital bliss in action. Dewey takes charge.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, you guys find the phones and we'll begin questioning suspects. Gale nods. She couldn’t have said it better herself.  64

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A busy corridor. STUDENTS come and go, eyeing the DEPUTIE as they move amongst them. Mr. Baker is seen, watching to

dialogues.speaker: AT THE END OF THE HALL
dialogues.text: Robbie has his FLIP CAMERA out, filming. While Charlie stands next to him.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Somebody is looking for a killer.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: Incoming. Robbie refers to Dewey and Gale approaching.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Charlie Walker? Charlie raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale looks around the room. Sees all the video equipment computers and film-making paraphernalia. And the posters the wall. Lots of horror movie posters.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Audio visual lab. We’re one rung below the Glee club.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: We're awaiting our own TV show. We have hope.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: First, let me just say, it isa supreme honor to be a suspect. May we film the interrogation? Robbie films with his FLIP. Deputy Hicks casually takes i from him. Dewey and Gale eye Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: GALE DEWEY
dialogues.text: Where’s your cell phone, Where’s your cell phone, son? Charlie? Dewey looks to Gale. “Shut up”.  65

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I lost it. It was stolen.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t know what happened to it. Your Deputy asked already. I can’t find it. Not since lunch yesterday. I sat it down for two seconds to grab a burrito and a Rockstar -- gone.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: He'll submit to a polygraph.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Where were you last night?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I know someone used it in Olivia’s murder. But it wasn’t me. I stayed in. Watched WICKER MAN. The original. Ask my mom. Look, I’m a horror junkie, to state the obvious, but I like my violence in movies, not in reality.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Maybe, you can’t tell the difference between the two.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m not Billy Loomis, Sheriff. If anything, I’m Randy, the film geek. I just got accepted to Tisch.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: He drops that, “Tisch”, like it’s gonna get him laid.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: That makes you a prime suspect in my book.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: He’s right, he’s too obvious.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Besides, I don’t do teen slasher. I’m more cult, Argento, early Lynch, my tastes are subversive.  66

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: Very subversive. Henry Knowles is irrelevant.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I'd never partake in some lame sequelitis retread.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Is that what you think is going on? Both boys nod. These guys are “Who’s on first” with their timing.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, someone’s trying to bring the STAB franchise back with a reboot.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: Re-imagining.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: And it sucks. It doesn’t need to be brought back. This genre trend of shit remakes needs to stop. Rob Zombie.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: Michael Bay.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Because for every DARK KNIGHT there’s 50 PROM NIGHTS. Dewey looks to Gale. She shakes her head. These guys are harmless. Just then, a TAP on the door. Dewey looks up to see Deputy Hicks motioning to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deputy Hicks leads Dewey and Gale through the school’s parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: We got a hit. Tony is there with a cell phone.  67

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Jenny Randall’s cell and Charlie Walker's cell. I’m dialing them now. A MUFFLED RINGTONE comes from the trunk of the car.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And now Charlie Walker's. A few seconds and the 2001 THEME RINGTONE plays.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Let’s open it.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Who's car is this?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BAKER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s mine. What’s going on? They turn to see school teacher, Mr. Baker, approach.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: We need you to open your trunk. Mr. Baker pulls out his KEYS and BEEPS. The trunk opens. The very first thing everyone sees is the GHOST FACE star up. It’s stained with blood. They all turn to Mr. Baker. Hands on their holsters. INT. JILL’S BEDROOM - ROBERTS HOUSE - AFTERNOON CLOSE ON THE TV -- THE LOCAL NEWS. It’s MUTED. Jill is on the bed with her laptop talking to Kirby -- vi iChat. Kirby is at her house.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I'm sick of this house. It’s creepy being here after last night.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Come over here. We’1l be sad together. Bring your body guards.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Maybe. I dunno what to do.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: It’s two whole blocks. You'll be safe. I’m the one marked for death. I’m the sidekick. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Second banana always gets it. You're the new Sidney Prescott. Survival rate high.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I don’t wanna be the new Sidney. I’ll see ya later. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: (iChat) Buh-bye. Jill shuts her laptop. Gets up and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill moves to the top of the stairs. She can partially se Sidney -- she’s on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: (on phone) I’m postponing the tour indefinitely. I can’t... Jill returns to her bedroom. INT. JILL’S BEDROOM - ROBERTS HOUSE - AFTERNOON Jill enters, closes the door to reveal TREVOR. Jill JUMPS

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Trevor. How did you get in here?

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: The same way I always do. The patio stairs. I had to see you. I’m sorry about Olivia.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t be here. He ignores this. He goes to her, inspects her bandaged ar

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Are you okay? I was worried. I know I screwed up but I care about you. I can’t just turn that off. You were almost killed. His sincerity is convincing. Jill softens. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do they have any idea who did it?  69

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: No. They think it’s, ya know, like in the movies. Jill can’t help herself. She's glad he’s there. Despite their issues. He takes her in his arms. They hug for a lo moment. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: JILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This doesn’t mean anything. I don't forgive you. But she continues to hold him.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t. I’m guilty. Jill pulls away. Looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I screwed up. I’m not going to lie. Not after what’s happened to you. Jessica and I lit up and got stoned, we messed around and got caught. None of it matters now. He’s powerfully honest. This hits Jill hard.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: You lost your scholarship.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Guess I didn’t want it. That’s what my mom said. She said I sabotaged myself. Just then, the DOOR OPENS. It’s Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Hey, are you hungry? I’m sorry-- She's surprised to see Trevor in the room.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: It’s okay, Sid. This is Trevor. He was just leaving. Trevor looks to Jill. She’s incredibly confused. Her face says it’s time for him to go. He gets up and starts out.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was leaving.  70 At the doorway, he passes by Sidney -- extremely close. Their eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s nice to meet you. You’re smaller in person. Trevor and Sidney’s eyes meet. He smiles. It’s just enoug to make Sid uncomfortable. She takes a step back, allows Trevor room to pass. Then, covers to Jill. Just then, NOISE from outside takes their attention. They both go to look out the window. The REPORTERS are packing and taking off.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Something happened. They turn to the TV -- Jill HITS the VOLUME.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: A suspect is now in custody. Jill and Sidney share a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Baker sits in the hot seat. Dewey questions him.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BAKER
dialogues.text: This is crazy. Somebody put those things in my car.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: And how did they do that, Mr. Baker?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BAKER
dialogues.text: Twenty different ways to Sunday is how. C’mon, Sheriff--

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE GLASS
dialogues.text: Gale and Deputy Hicks watch.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: He didn’t do it.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: How can you tell? The evidence is overwhelming.  71

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Because the evidence is overwhelming. Would you leave three cell phones, a mask, and a bloody knife in your trunk?

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE INTERROGATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Mr. Baker is beginning to get worried.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BAKER
dialogues.text: Look, I’m being framed. It’s obvious.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Who would want to frame you?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BAKER
dialogues.text: I could make a list. I’m an asshole. Ask any of my students. Dewey slides a pad and paper towards him.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: Why don’t you make a list?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BAKER
dialogues.text: I'm getting really nervous here. I think I should speak to a lawyer before this goes any further. Mr. Baker sits back in his chair. He’s done talking. Dewe looks to the mirror -- shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE GLASS
dialogues.text: Gale and Hicks continue.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: He lawyered up fast.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: He’s innocent.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: Could I play devil’s advocate for a moment. Maybe he never thought we'd look in the trunk. Maybe he didn’t have time to dispose of the evidence. Maybe he’s stupid. Gale looks to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you like us to do, Deputy Judy?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: I think we should hold him.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Sure, why not. And if no one else dies, then we’ll know you were right. But until then, we have a killer to find. 72 Gale starts off as Hicks stops her, troubled by something

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: Um, Gale? Small thing. It’s Deputy Hicks. Or Judy. But not Deputy Judy. Gale resists the urge to rip her apart. Instead,

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Got it. Another small thing. It’s okay to be in love with my husband but if you ever act on it -- I’1l cut your balls off. Gale exits. Off Deputy Hicks--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge spatial home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: she smiles. A big family room/game room. A pool table and other games one side. A huge FLAT SCREEN home theatre set-up on the other. Robbie is shooting pool while Kirby is selecting MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: We should have guessed Baker. He was too quiet. Repressed mommy issues.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: It’s this town. Woodsboro. It breeds psychos. Why are we listening to this crap?  73

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Because tonight is about Olivia and I found her iPod in my car and this is her playlist. You’re free to leave. Kirby is adamant.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: Great tunes, dude. To Olivia.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Thank you. Kirby moves into the connecting kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spacious kitchen. Built into the walls of the kitchen a SEVERAL SECURITY CAMERAS. Kirby eyes one. Sees Jill and the Deputies coming up the walk. She races to the door. INT. FOYER - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Kirby opens the front door to greet Jill.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: You made it.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: They need to take a look around.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Sure. Come on in. Hoss and Perkins enter after Jill. They look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid sits in an over-sized chair watching TV. She channel surfs. It’s wall to wall coverage of the murders. A NEWS ANCHOR talks to a REPORTER in the field.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR
dialogues.text: (from TV) Was an arrest made? Or is Stuart Baker only a person of interest?

dialogues.speaker: FIELD REPORTER
dialogues.text: It’s unclear. However, sources say the evidence is substantial.  74 Sid SWITCHES channels. More coverage. Images of the victims. Of herself. Past victims. (Randy, Tatum) Past killers. (Billy Loomis, Micky) The current victims. Gale’ book. Of Gale reporting. Past and present merge together with every flip of the remote. Sidney switches it over to a GOSSIP SHOW on the E CHANNEL

dialogues.speaker: GOSSIP HOST
dialogues.text: “Spatial Films announced today the next sequel in the STAB franchise has been fast tracked. No doubt due to the four murders that...” Sid gives up. She turns the TV OFF when she hears... TAT-TAT-TAT. A NOISE. She freezes. Looks to patio doors. Sidney rises and goes to the TWO LARGE GLASS doors that l to the deck and back yard. It’s dark. She FLIPS the back porch light. JUMPS. Startle by her own reflection. Jesus... She instantly sees the source of the NOISE. A WIND CHIME tangled itself around the post of the back porch. The nig breeze causes it to TAT-TAT against the post. She OPENS the door and steps out onto the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid quickly tries to untangle the chime. She’s very vulnerable standing out there alone. The yard is pitch bl around her. She pulls on the chime and ends up bringing it down on to her. Shit. She then attempts to hang it back up but it’s too much trouble. Fuck it. She tosses it to the side of t porch. She steps back inside. Locks the door. TURNS the outside light out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid enters the kitchen and goes to the fridge. Opens it a grabs a water when... TAT-TAT-TAT. Sid spins around to the family room.  75

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney approaches the back glass doors again. Pitch black She CLICKS on the porch light to reveal-- The WIND CHIME is now back hanging from the porch post. Right where it was. TAT-TAT. But how? Who put it back? Sid's face goes pale when-- KATE’S HEAD POPS UP FROM BELOW THE WINDOW. SID SCREAMS. Kate was bent over looking under a potted plant.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I can’t find the key. Sid recovers. Opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: It’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Where is everybody? Kate goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The wind chime fell down.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: The Deputies took Jill over to Kirby’s house. I thought it was okay. Away from me is always a good thing. Sid's making a joke. She shuts and locks the door.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Did you see they got the guy?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I saw the news. I haven’t heard from Dewey yet.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: The English teacher. Figures. That calls for a glass of wine. Whaddya say? Kate starts for the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: You go ahead. I’m gonna turn in.  76 Kate nods. Disappointed, but she understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney climbs the stairs and moves down the hall to her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid enters the bedroom. Grabs her suitcase when her CELL PHONE RINGS. She grabs it -- sees the CALLER ID is blocke She debates. Then, answers it.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: GHOSTFACE
dialogues.text: Hello, Sidney. Sidney freezes. Says nothing. Pure silence. GHOSTFACE (CONT’D) Nothing to say?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: You called me. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: GHOSTFACE
dialogues.text: I want you dead. Sidney says nothing. GHOSTFACE (CONT’D) Whaddya say?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: And then what? I die and then what?

dialogues.speaker: GHOSTFACE
dialogues.text: The movie ends. (silence) Tell ya what, I’ll have a glass of wine while you think it over. Sidney BOLTS from the room. She goes racing down the stai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney comes racing into the kitchen to find-- Aunt Kate pouring a glass of wine. She looks up, startled see Sidney so panicked.  77

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: We need to get out of here now. Sidney dials her CELL. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dewey, Jesus, answer. (dials again) This is Sidney Prescott, I’m at Kate Roberts house, please, hurry. Just then, Aunt Kate’s phone RINGS. Kate answers it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello. (then) It’s for you. She holds the phone out but Sid won’t take it. Instead, s motions they need get out of the house. “He’s in the hous She points to her ear. “He can hear us.” Sid grabs a knif from the sink. Then, she leads Kate from the kitchen to t family room to the...

dialogues.speaker: THE GLASS PATIO DOORS
dialogues.text: Sidney HITS the porch light to REVEAL-- GHOST FACE standing on the back porch. Kate SCREAMS. They both turn and race back through the house, through the kitchen to... INT. FOYER - ROBERT’S HOUSE - NIGHT Kate and Sid reach the front door. Kate UNLOCKS IT and RI IT OPEN to find...

dialogues.speaker: CATCHING KATE IN THE CHEST.
dialogues.text: Sidney SCREAMS. As Kate falls back against her. Sidney stumbles back against the wall. GHOSTFACE continues attacking, STABBING Kate repeatedly. Her body is a shield, protecting Sidney. Several more STRIKES. Finally, Sidney breaks free -- STRIKES with her knife. But--  78 BLADE HITS BLADE. The slightest pause. It’s just enough for Sidney to flee room. Suddenly, POLICE SIRENS can be heard approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney races back through the kitchen to the... INT. FAMILY ROOM - ROBERT’S HOUSE Sid races to the back patio doors. She opens them, then stops when she sees... GHOSTFACE STANDING DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF HER. What? Then, she realizes -- it’s not a person -- only a costume hangi from the wind chime. It was put there deliberately. She looks behind her just as... GHOSTFACE LUNGES -- BARRELS into Sidney. They both go to ground, tumbling, rolling across the grass of the back ya Sidney is thrown onto her back -- GHOSTFACE atop her. KNI RAISED. He STRIKES down. Sid blocks it with her arm. It slices into her -- cutting her forearm. She SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff Jeep pulls into the drive. Dewey and Gale lea from the car, racing to the house. A SQUAD CAR is right behind them -- SIRENS BLARING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is struggling underneath Ghostface. DEWEY AND GALE can be heard inside. So does Ghostface -- he looks to the house -- sees Dewey and others coming... It’s all the time Sid needs - she WHACKS GHOSTFACE. He tumbles over. Sid manages to crawl away... she gets to he feet and turns to find... AN EMPTY YARD. Ghostface has completely disappeared. A si gate swings ajar.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE PATIO DOORS
dialogues.text: Dewey and Gale race to Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Are you okay?  79 Sidney nods as Dewey races to the side gate. Gun drawn. B the killer is long gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PATROL CAR sits in the driveway of Kirby’s house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoss and Perkins sit in the front seat, in mid-convo.

dialogues.speaker: PERKINS
dialogues.text: The cops guarding outside the house always get it. It’s a movie cop rule. It sucks to be a cop ina movie unless you’re Bruce Willis.

dialogues.speaker: HOSS
dialogues.text: Not all cops die in movies.

dialogues.speaker: PERKINS
dialogues.text: No, but if it’s your last day before retirement -- you do. Or if you're a rookie and just found out your wife is pregnant -- you do. Or if your partner is better looking than you -- you do. Hoss looks in the rear-view mirror to judge his looks.

dialogues.speaker: PERKINS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I win that one.

dialogues.speaker: HOSS
dialogues.text: (seeing something) Who do we have here? Charlie and Trevor can be seen walking up to the house. Perkins FLASHES the RED LIGHTS. They stop. Hoss opens the car door.

dialogues.speaker: HOSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll be right back. Perkins starts SNICKERING at him. Hoss doesn’t get it.

dialogues.speaker: HOSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What did I say? Hoss gets out of the car. Starts for the guys.  80 INT. FAMILY ROOM - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Kirby is going through the MOVIE MENU on the FLAT SCREEN. Jill is on the couch. Robbie is in the kitchen making a drink.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: Where’s the tequila? I have limes, margarita mix and no tequila. Kirby sends attitude his way.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: There's vodka. Drink the goddamn vodka and shut up. (re: TV) What are we watching?

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: Zombies.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: No horror. Please? I beg you guys. Can we watch a comedy or something?

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: A zombie comedy. You can’t go wrong with zombies. Just then, the DOORBELL RINGS. Kirby hands Jill the remot

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Why don’t you pick? But nothing with Adam Sandler, Jim Carrey, Ben Stiller, Owen Wilson, Jack Black, or Will Ferrell. Kirby goes for the door.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And it can’t be directed by Brett Ratner. INT. FOYER - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Kirby races to the door. Opens it to find Deputy Hoss.

dialogues.speaker: HOSS
dialogues.text: You got some visitors. Charlie and Trevor stand behind him. Kirby sees Charlie a points.  81

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: He’s cool, but I don’t about you. Does Jill know you’re coming? (to Hoss) Yes, they can come in. Charlie and Trevor enter. Kirby stops Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You be cool. I don’t want any bullshit drama. You upset Jill and you're out of here. She leads them into the house.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This isn’t a party. Okay? No ruckus. We’re very chill tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill sees Charlie and Trevor enter. Kirby shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Just say the word and he’s 86.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: I can go now. I don’t wanna want cause a problem.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: It’s okay. Jill and Trevor share a look. EXT. ROBERT’S HOUSE - NIGHT - LITTLE LATER A CORONER'S VAN, AMBULANCE, COP CARS, REPORTERS are parke front of the house. Dewey is there. He speaks to Deputy Hicks.

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: We have to keep this out of the news until we notify Jill. Deputy Hicks nods, moving up the porch steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PARAMEDIC bandage Sid’s arm. She’s surprisingly calm. Gale and Dewey are nearby.  82

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: We need to get you to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: It's okay, I’m fine. Sid turns to Gale.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where’s Jill?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: She's safe.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I should tell her myself. If someone could take me to her?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: We’ll have her brought to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: No, I need to see her now. Before she hears about this. Gale looks to Deputy Hicks as she passes through.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Deputy Judy? Deputy Hicks hates being called that, but plays nice.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: Yes, Gale.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Will you see to it that Sidney is taken to Jill?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Sidney rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Robbie are playing a game of pool, in the mid of a heated discussion.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: You're totally missing my point.  83

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You're missing mine. The original STAB was an irreverent self aware post-modern deconstruction of the horror genre. How do you remake it?

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: You tap into the zeitgeist and take it to the next level.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: And what’s the next level?

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: Post-post-modern unaware self awareness. The genre has evolved. The rules have changed.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No, they haven't. If anything it’s gone backwards. What rules have changed?

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: You don’t have to be a virgin to survive anymore. Kirby brings them drinks.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: That’s just an update. You still have to be the less slutty one.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Don’t bring her into this. She knows nothing.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: I can trivia you under any table.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Who played Leather Face first?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: (instantly) Gunnar Hansen.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: Smoke. Charlie gives Kirby a sexy stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt that. Did you feel that? That charge that moved between us just then. It was there. Kirby shoots him a look. “In your dreams.”

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: New rule. You can kill gay people now. You couldn’t do that in the 90's. Gay characters were off limits. Total social progress.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: But racial awareness has not changed. The black person still can’t be the killer.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: Yet. But Obama’s in office. He’ll change that.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: The post-modern era of the 90's is what triggered these remakes to begin with.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: It exposed the cliches so they had no choice but to start over.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Because there’s no such thing as a new idea.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: That is sadistically sad. I refuse to believe it. So if you drink and do drugs -- will you live?

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: You can even say, “I'll be right back.”

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Here’s the rule. Do the double reverse of every cliche and you'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Trevor makes a drink. He holds up the bottle of vodka.  85

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: No thanks. He puts it down. He’ll pass too. He pours two sodas.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: I can’t believe Mr. Baker was behind it. That’s crazy. Do they have any idea why?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Because he’s bananas. You should be happy.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: He busted you good.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Isn’t Baker the one who caught you in the locker room with the (mimes weed) and the (mimes tits)? Trevor resists ripping his head off. Charlie knows he’s stirring up trouble.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gotta pee. Talk amongst yourselves. Charlie exits into the foyer, leaving Trevor and Jill alo

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Baker is the one who caught you in the locker room?

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Yeah, so?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I just didn’t know.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: It’s not like I’m happy about it. Kirby grabs Jill by the arm and pulls her away.  86

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: You come with me. (to Trevor) We'll be back. Kirby disappears with Jill. Trevor watches as Kirby leads Jill upstairs. Trevor goes to the family room. The back patio doors are wide open. Robbie has stepped out on the back deck to smoke a cigare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie lights up a cigarette. Looks around the back deck. Patio furniture, built-in barbecue, and bar. Manicured gardens. Green grass. A detached guest house in the rear. Very nicely done. Robbie goes to the bar and digs around. He finds tequila. Ah. Jackpot. He pours a shot when CREEAAK! A NOISE takes his attention. He looks around. But sees nothing. EXT. DRIVEWAY - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Hoss and Perkins are in the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: PERKINS
dialogues.text: I don’t know why we have to sit out here. They could have invited us in.

dialogues.speaker: HOSS
dialogues.text: They would polite. They’re kids.

dialogues.speaker: PERKINS
dialogues.text: Time to do a perimeter check.

dialogues.speaker: HOSS
dialogues.text: I'll go. I hate sitting in this car. I'll be back. Oh wait, I’m not supposed to say that -- am I? I won't be back.

dialogues.speaker: PERKINS
dialogues.text: Tricky area. In this situation when there’s a good chance you could return and find me dead, it could go either way. Hoss gets out of the car.  87 INT. BEDROOM - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Kirby’s alternative influenced bedroom. Jill and Kirby ar on the bed, chatting.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: I can send Trevor packing. He’s acting all creepy eye.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I don’t think he knows what to say to me.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: There’s something weird going on with him. Ya know, like he’s... (drops it) Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What? Say it.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: All this STAB talk about remakes. If the killer was not only following the rules of horror movies but the plot of what happened before... he’s Billy Loomis to your Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Trevor’s not a killer.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: I wouldn't guess Mr. Baker to be one either. Forget it, I watch too many horror movies. Jill falls back on the bed. Her mind reeling.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I get you something?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I just lay here for a second?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: You take all the time you need. I'll be downstairs. Kirby gets up and goes to the door.  88

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you need anything, holla. Kirby exits, closing the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deputy Hoss moves around the side of the house. He comes a side gate. He checks it. It’s locked. He peers over the fence. He sees an empty yard. Everything seems okay. He starts back. EXT. FRONT YARD - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Hoss comes around the side of the house. He crosses the front yard to the driveway to the PATROL CAR. He can see Perkins inside. Very still. Is he sleeping? Th closer Hoss gets, the more worried he becomes.

dialogues.speaker: HOSS
dialogues.text: Perkins? He comes around to the driver's side. Sees clearly that Perkins is slumped over the wheel. He races to him. Suddenly Perkins lifts up, LAUGHING UNCONTROLLABLY.

dialogues.speaker: PERKINS
dialogues.text: You're too easy. Hoss wants to smack him but he’s STABBED IN THE CHEST. It comes fast and quick. FROM BEHIND. The KNIFE PENETRATES DEEP. Hoss CRIES OUT. Drops to the ground revealing... THE GHOST FACE BEHIND HIM. Perkins reaches for his gun, b he’s too slow. The GHOST FACE RUSHES HIM -- IN ONE SWIFT MOVE...

dialogues.speaker: THE KNIFE SLICES HIS NECK OPEN
dialogues.text: Death is quick for both men. The GHOST FACE KILLER works fast. He pops the trunk. He’s going to hide the bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE SECURITY MONITORS -- GHOSTFACE is seen closi the trunk and starting back toward the house -- disappear from view. The CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal an...

dialogues.speaker: AN EMPTY KITCHEN
dialogues.text: 89 Several eerie moments and then Kirby enters. Looks around

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Where is everybody? She peeks into the family room. Sees the patio doors open

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello? She goes back to the fridge. Opens it. Grabs a water. Whe he closes it... CHARLIE IS THERE. Kirby doesn’t jump at all.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You were supposed to jump.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: The refrigerator door is no-scare for me. It’s right up there with the medicine cabinet mirror.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Now, see the medicine cabinet gets me every time. It’s the shower curtain that’s lame.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Or the cat through the widow. Meoooow. Kirby makes a HISSING CAT SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: We really should hook up. Who else gets you better than me? He’s getting too close. Kirby pushes by him.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Where did everyone go? Where’s Robbie? Kirby looks to the family room.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Maybe, he left. Wanna watch a movie? Kirby considers it.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: You promise not to rub all over me?  90

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I can do that. Whaddya want to watch? Charlie goes to the remote -- starts to key up the ON SCR LIBRARY.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Anything. But no torture porn, shaky cam, docu-horror, manga-— techno, 3D or PG-13 shit-ola.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Soul mates. Kirby shakes her head. Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill lies down, takes the pillow and makes herself comfortable. But, she’s restless. She sits up. Goes to the window. Looks out. Sees the Detective’s car outside. A NOISE behind her. She turns and looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill steps out into the hall. HEARS music from below. Loo over the bannister to the FOYER. Sees no one. She goes ba into Kirby’s bedroom. Moves to the adjoining bathroom. Sh opens up the MEDICINE CABINET. Grabs some Tylenol. CLOSES IT. No one’s behind her. She pops them and sips some water. Returns to...

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: To find a FIGURE STANDING IN THE DARK. Jill JUMPS. From t shadows emerges Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: I was leaving. I wanted to say good-night. Jill is nervous being alone with him.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Good-night.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: That’s it?  91

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I think you should quit while you're ahead.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Are you sure you wanna be alone? I could stay for a while. We could just talk. Jill thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Not tonight, Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: I’m sorry about Olivia. Jill nods, appreciates it. He gives her one last look and exits. Once he’s gone, Jill falls back on the bed. SIGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirby grabs some chips and drinks. She glances over to th SECURITY MONITORS. Something catches her eye. She sees SOMEONE in the back yard as they quickly disappear into t GUEST HOUSE. She starts for the patio doors. EXT. BACK PORCH - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Kirby emerges from the patio doors. Charlie follows, curious.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: I saw someone on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Was it a small Asian girl with dark hair? Kirby LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Will you go look?  92

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You're kidding right? I’ma lot of things, brave is not one of them.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: For God's sake. Kirby crosses the yard.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I don’t feel guilty. Or less of a man. Whatever. Kirby crosses to the... EXT. GUEST HOUSE - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT A small guest cottage on the rear of the property. The fr door is made of glass but’s it’s completely dark inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirby enters the guest house. Her hand feels around for t light switch. She CLICKS on the light. Looks around. It’s empty. She goes to the bedroom. Looks inside. She sees SOMEBODY on the bed. She moves closer. It’s Robbie. He lays incredibly still.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Robbie? What are you doing? Just then, he rises. YAWNING.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Kirby. What did I drink? Three beer?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: You had some vodka too.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: I was thinking about Olivia, ya know. Having a moment.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: C’mon, you shouldn’t be out here. Robbie gets up and they both head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Together they cross back to the house.  93

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie and Kirby enter. Once again, no one is there. The entire room is empty.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: What is going on? Where did Charlie go?

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: Where’s Jill and Trevor?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. (calling out) Charlie? Kirby is closing and locking the patio doors when the PHO RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: I'll get it. Robbie races to the kitchen counter. Grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: GHOSTFACE
dialogues.text: You're dead.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: What? Just then, GHOSTFACE EXPLODES OUT OF THE PANTRY. He attac with the KNIFE. It strikes Robbie in the chest. Then, a SLIT across the throat. He doesn’t utter a sound. Kirby turns from the door just in time to see Robbie's lifeless body drop out of view. GHOST FACE turns his attention to Kirby. She SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Noooooo. She takes off, running out the patio doors into...

dialogues.speaker: THE BACK YARD
dialogues.text: She runs back to the...  94

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She races inside and shuts the door, locking it. Then, sh races to the SLIDING GLASS DOORS that overlook the back y She makes sure all entries are locked. INT. FRONT YARD - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT A SQUAD CAR pulls up in front. Gale and Deputy Hicks get out. Sidney immediately starts for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: Hold up, Ms. Prescott. Sidney starts up the walk while Hicks goes to the PATROL in the driveway. Hicks shines a FLASHLIGHT on the empty c She aims it to the door and cement. It illuminates blood. DEPUTY HICKS (CONT’D) Oh my God. Sidney sees the look on Deputy Hick’s face.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Jilli!!! Sidney bolts for the house. She races up the porch steps inside the house. INT. FOYER - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Sidney races into the house. She HEARS a NOISE from upstairs, quickly contemplates, but then a NOISE from the kitchen. Sidney enters the kitchen, sees Robbie’s body crumpled on kitchen floor. She grabs quickly searches the draws for a weapon. She finds a KITCHEN KNIFE. She looks to the open patio doors. Goes for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney sees Kirby at the window of the guest house. Sidne goes for her. Kirby unlocks the door and races towards. Relieved to see her.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Where’s Jill?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Upstairs.  95

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: C’mon... Just then, Charlie emerges from the house, looking really scared.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Robbie’s dead. Sidney doesn’t know what to think of him. She holds out t knife.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Stay back.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Why? What did I do?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: He’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Are you sure? There’s blood on his hands. Kirby sees the blood on his hands.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Why do you have blood on your hands, Charlie? Charlie holds up his hands.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I tried to help Robbie. Charlie is honestly scared out of his mind. He takes a st towards them when Sidney shields Kirby, protecting her. Kirby races back inside the guest house. Sid is right beh her. They lock the door. Charlie follows them.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please. I haven’t done anything. We gotta get out of here. INT. FOYER - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Deputy Hicks enters. Gun drawn. A LIGHT at the top of the stairs takes her attention. It’s followed by a CLOSING DO

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HICKS
dialogues.text: Sidney?  96 Hicks, against all better judgement, climbs the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie stands just outside the glass doors. He pleads wi them. While Sidney dials her CELL PHONE. She’s calling Ji But there’s no answer.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: C’mon, open up. He BEATS on the glass window. His face is panicked.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Go away, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hurry, we need to go... Kirby is freaking out. She fights back her emotion. Just then, Kirby and Sidney see GHOST FACE appears behind Charlie. She realizes she was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Watch out... Charlie turns just as the KNIFE STRIKES. He ducks, races away, back into the yard. The GHOST FACE goes after him. They disappear from view. Kirby moves to the next window, just misses them. The windows of the room only face the side yard. She goes into the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a small bedroom that opens up onto the whole back ya Two huge glass doors look out onto the yard and pool. Suddenly, the LIGHTS GO OUT. The back yard is plunged int darkness. Shit. What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill sits up on the bed. HEARS a noise from the hallway. goes to the door and opens it. Peeks out. She sees a SHAD dance across the wall. She steps into...  97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill moves down the hall. There’s an open doorway at the end. Jill goes to it. Peers in. She sees Deputy Hicks standing with a GHOST FACE MASK in her hand. Hicks sees her -- pulls her gun. Jill throws her hands up frightened. INT. GUEST HOUSE - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Sidney backs away from the glass. Just then, her CELL PHO RINGS. She answers it.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: (into cell) What? Kirby watches Sidney. Terrified.

dialogues.speaker: GHOST FACE
dialogues.text: (from phone) Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: (into phone) For what?

dialogues.speaker: GHOST FACE
dialogues.text: To play a game. Sidney turns angry.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: I’m not playing, asshole. Sidney hangs up. A shivering Kirby stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Should you have hung up on him? Just then, BACK YARD LIGHTS flood the yard. Both Sidney and Kirby go to the glass doors and look out onto...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of the yard, directly facing the GUEST HOUS Charlie sits in a patio chair. Bound by electrical tape. covers his mouth, his arms, and legs. He STRUGGLES to free himself, RIPPING and PULLING -- but impossible.  98

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE GUEST HOUSE
dialogues.text: Kirby CRIES OUT. She’s frighteningly sober. CRAZED.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Don’t... oh god, don’t, please... She starts for the door when Sidney grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: No, don’t... And then the phone RINGS. Sid answers.

dialogues.speaker: GHOST FACE
dialogues.text: Let's try this again. (then) You know how this works. First question. Are you ready? No, Sid’s not ready. She’s not ready at all.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: No, I’m not ready. A shaking, terrified, Kirby stares at Charlie in the yard Their eyes meet. He’s begging for his life. Kirby turns t Sidney, finding courage.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: I’m ready. Sidney puts her cell on SPEAKER so Kirby can hear.

dialogues.speaker: GHOST FACE
dialogues.text: Easy warm-up: Name the killer in

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: (interrupting question) Billy Loomis, Stu Macher, Mickey Altieri, Debbie Salt aka Nancy Loomis, Roman Bridger. Kirby’s brain is crazily focused. She knows her shit.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Name the first victim in STAB?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Easy. Casey-- oh, wait, no it was her boyfriend, in the back yard--.  99

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: No, it’s a trick question. (into phone) Maureen Prescott was the first victim a year earlier. Kirby nods. Yes, of course.

dialogues.speaker: GHOST FACE
dialogues.text: Very nice. Directed EVIL DEAD--

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Sam Raimi.

dialogues.speaker: GHOST FACE
dialogues.text: Karen Black starred in...

dialogues.speaker: TRILOGY OF TERROR.
dialogues.text: Kirby’s an ace with trivia. Sidney watches her, impressed Then, she goes to Charlie in the yard -- she still holds knife. Sid quietly opens the door when--

dialogues.speaker: GHOST FACE
dialogues.text: Sidney, you step out that door and I will slit him ear to ear. Sid closes the door back.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK YARD
dialogues.text: Charlie is watching, horrified, his life in their hands.

dialogues.speaker: GHOST FACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What current remake featured--

dialogues.speaker: PROM NIGHT, HOUSE OF WAX, PIRAHNA,
dialogues.text: THE FOG -- I got it, right? It was one of those, right? As Kirby hopes one of those was the answer to the questio she never heard. So is Sidney. Their hearts are racing.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK YARD
dialogues.text: 100 Charlie watches, freaked, but rooting, praying...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE GUEST HOUSE
dialogues.text: The deadly Q&A continues, fast and focused--

dialogues.speaker: GHOST FACE
dialogues.text: The original mask in Hallow--

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Wiliam Shatner

dialogues.speaker: GHOST FACE
dialogues.text: Original Freddy Krueger?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Robert Englund.

dialogues.speaker: GHOST FACE
dialogues.text: Saw?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: Tobin Bell.

dialogues.speaker: GHOST FACE
dialogues.text: Johnny Depp...

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: First NIGHTMARE.

dialogues.speaker: GHOST FACE
dialogues.text: How old was Jason when he drowned in Camp Crystal Lake? This stops her. Huh?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: How old? Are you fucking kidding me? That’s not a real question. Kirby racks her brain -- she has no fucking idea.

dialogues.speaker: GHOST FACE
dialogues.text: Clock’s ticking... Kirby goes nuts, trying to figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: He didn’t drown -- another trick question.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK YARD
dialogues.text: Charlie TREMBLES and SHAKES -- FREAKING OUT.  101

dialogues.speaker: GHOST FACE
dialogues.text: When he was believed to have drowned?

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: He was a little kid. He was... Shit. Kirby is mouthing “9? 10?...” She’s counting it out on her fingers. She has no idea. She’s a nervous wreck. Sidney tries to help.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Go with one. Nine works.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: (works it out) Wait. In the FINAL CHAPTER we learned Mrs. Vorhees gave birth in 1946, right? And, um, in the original, the two counselors were killed in the flashback in ‘58 and Jason drowned the summer before, ‘57, so born in ‘46, drowned in ‘57 would make him, uh, uh, uh -- ELEVEN!!! Jason was 11, 11, 11, yes!!! Kirby leaps up. With mad and crazy euphora.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK YARD
dialogues.text: Charlie is relieved. Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE GUEST HOUSE
dialogues.text: Sid looks around the yard. It’s deadly quiet.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello? Are you there?

dialogues.speaker: AUTOMATED VOICE
dialogues.text: (from cell) “If you’d like to make a call, please hang up...” Sidney kills it. Looks around. Turns to Kirby.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: You won. Okay, let’s try to get Charlie get to the house. Okay? A petrified Kirby can only nod.  102

dialogues.speaker: IN THE YARD
dialogues.text: Charlie watches the, curious as to hwat they’re up to. Sidney unlatches the door. Looks to the left, to the righ Slowly, she steps out. Kirb joins her. ON CHARLIE -- Scared. Worried. Hopeful. Kirby looks at the back yard. To the main house. There’s sign of anyone. Anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: I won. Didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: IN THE YARD
dialogues.text: Casey and Sid race to Charlie. They rips at the tape arou his arms. All the while, looking around into the shadows the yard, knowing the KILLER could be anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I won, Charlie. I won. She rips the tap of his mouth, then arms...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oh god, hurry...

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Finish this and get outta her. I gotta find Jill. Sidney starts for the main house while Kirby continues freeing Charlie. With his hands free, Charlie starts helping. He rips his legs free from the chair. He rises up. He grabs Kirby, kisses her for saving his life.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBY
dialogues.text: We have to hurry.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, just one thing. She looks at Charlie -- his expression turns. Then, she s the KNIFE he reaches for, hidden in the chair. The next moment happens fast -- AS CHARLIE STABS HER WITH THE KNIF It SLICES INTO KIRBY’S stomach. She stumbles back.  103

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How did you fucking know 11? You fucking cow, you were supposed to miss that one. Goddammit. Kirby looks at him with childlike innocence. Then, the pa and shock follow.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah, you win alright. You fucking prick tease. You win death. He STABS her again -- FURIOUS AT HER. She COUGHS UP, unab to speak -- a look of stunned horror. He STABS HER SEVERA MORE TIMES -- QUICK JABS. Kirby manages a SCREAM. Sidney turns in time to see Kirby drop to the ground. As Charlie meets Sid’s stare.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, you look genuinely surprised. I can explain. He takes a step towards Sid. She stumbles back inside the house. He starts for her.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: Sid locks the doors. Races through the house to the... INT. FOYER - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT She rips the front door open as GHOST FACE LUNGES AT HER, waiting for her. Sid flees to the only place she can -- upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid races up the stairs and down the hall. GHOST FACE is fast on her heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney races inside Kirby’s bedroom. She locks the doors, runs to the bathroom. She shuts it. Locks it. Then... SHE HEARS SOMETHING. It comes from behind the shower curtain. Sidney reaches for the curtain -- pulls it aside find... TREVOR -- HE REACHES OUT. GRABS HER. Sidney SCREAMS. KNOCKS HIM OVER. Then, she moves fast. Sid rips the bathroom door and bolts.  104 Sid runs to Kirby’s bedroom door. She opens -- GHOST FACE before her. Sidney STRIKES with her kitchen knife. It's catches GHOST FACE’S ARM. He flinches. It’s enough f Sidney to squeak by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid races down the hall. She gets to the stair case. Look down to see Charlie climbing up -- knife in hand. Sidney runs down the hallway to an open doorway. She goes inside and trips instantly over something. She comes face to face with Deputy Hicks. Sidney is on to of her, staring directly into Hicks’ cold, dead eyes. SIDNEY SCREAMS. Rolls off her. Turns to see -- GHOST FACE enter the room. Sidney looks around. There’s no where els for her to run. Slowly, GHOST FACE approaches.

dialogues.speaker: GHOST FACE
dialogues.text: What’s the matter, Sid? You look like you've seen a ghost. And with that, the Ghost Face removes its mask, revealing Jill underneath. She sports a wicked smile as she slips o of the costume. Sidney’s face drops to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Yep, it’s me. Surprised.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Jill. No... Sidney tries to make a break for it. But she comes nose t nose with a loaded gun.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I’ve got the Deputy’s gun. I’m dying to shoot it. I’m so sick of the knife thing. Now, get up. Beat. As Sidney does as told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie is dragging Trevor’s body to the top of the stair It’s obvious now that his feet have been bound and he’s b seriously injured. His shirt is bloody red.  105

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: C'mon, Trevor, buddy, this might hurt a little. Charlie sits him up at the top of the stairs and then pus him. His body goes TUMBLING to the body. He lands with a THUD. And a CRACK. Something broke. He la at the bottom of the stairs -- CRYING OUT IN PAIN. Charli trots down to join him.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It looks like you broke your leg. That sucks. Charlie PRESSES down on it. Trevor SCREAMS IN AGONY.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: You fucker... Jill appears, leading Sidney down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (to Jill) You asked her the easy questions. Didn’t you use my list? I put the harder ones at the top. Why did you skip?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: It’s done. Can we move on?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Can we do him yet? With DNA testing, we’re good with time line. Jill turns the gun to Trevor -- without flinching. She shoots him in the forehead. He drops over dead.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Jesus... why... Jill turns the gun back on Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill and Charlie lead Sid into the kitchen where Robbie l dead on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You got it figured out yet, Sid? In keeping with our remake theme, Trevor and Robbie are this generation’s--  106

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Billy and Stu.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: And we’re the innocent victims.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: We're Sidney and Randy. And we get to go to college and have a sequel. But this time -- Randy gets the girl. Charlie moves to Jill -- she lets him kiss her. You get t sense she tolerates Charlie. They break. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You did real good. You're the perfect victim. Jill can’t hide it. She’s full of exhilaration.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I was so believable today. I told so many lies I actually believed them. I was born for this. Jill's true colors start to take shape. She’s a deeply troubled sociopath. She looks to Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: JILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon, let’s face it. I’ve had enough practice. Do you know what it was like growing up in the this family? In this town?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Her mother was a slut bag whore just like your mother. Sisters. I made out with her mom once. She got drunk and slipped me the tongue one night.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Drunk bitch.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: You crazy fucks... Just then, the PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Watch this.  107 Jill races for it. Grabs it haphazardly and sinks into a MASTER PERFORMANCE OF HYSTERIA AND FEAR.

dialogues.speaker: JILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into phone) Oh my God, help me. He’s trying to kill me. He killed Sidney... Help. Jill hangs up. Back to calm and poise. To Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: JILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C’mon, we need to get on with it. They’1l be here soon. He raises his arms -- as Jill holds the KNIFE. She’s goin to stab him.

dialogues.speaker: JILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m going to do this hard. It can’t be tentative.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: C'mon, baby, let’s do this old school, like Billy and Stu. It’s a remake, baby. (ala Chinatown) No, it’s a sequel. It’s a_ remake, sequel, remake, sequel, sister, daughter, sequel... Jill stabs him. She gets him DIRECTLY in the heart. He drops to his knees. Instant pain. But his face registers confusion too.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s not the way we rehearsed it... He doubles over, bleeding. She takes the opportunity -- STRIKES him again. And, in this moment, he realizes he’s been played and betrayed.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: There’s been a change of plans. The problem with you, Charlie. It’s always been about killing Sidney Prescott. My plan is a little bigger. I’m going to become her. And with that, Jill stabs him again. Charlie can’t believ it. He’s stunned and shocked. He falls back, crumbling to the floor. Still. As Jill looks down at him with a glimme of diabolical glee.  108 A quick kick of her foot. His body doesn’t move. He’s dea

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: How did you turn into this?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Nothing is ever what it seems. Your words, Sidney. I’ve always been this. You know what it’s like growing up related to you? All you hear is Sidney this, Sidney that, Sidney, Sidney...You were always so fucking special. Now it’s my turn. Jill takes the knife.

dialogues.speaker: JILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And now you have to die. Those are the rules.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: What rules?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: There’s only room for one lead. Let's face it, Sid, you’re ingenue days are over. Jill STABS Sidney with the knife. She GASPS in pain. Jill STABS her again quickly. This one WRACKS Sid’s body. She drops to her knees. Sidney’s eyes roll back in her head. Everything goes slow-motion.

dialogues.speaker: JILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Apropos. Finally, what should of happened 15 years ago. Sidney falls to the floor. Jill watches as Sidney draws h last breath. Sad. Tragic. Epic. All at once. Jill springs into action. She’s well rehearsed. She kneels next to Charlie’s body. She takes his limp han and claws at her own face, with careful attention to his fingers. She’s securing her DNA under his nails. She then makes sure his class ring is facing out on his middle finger and proceeds to PUNCH herself with his limp hand. It doesn't really create the desired effect. She tries BACKHANDING herself. That works better.  109 Quick and fast, she BASHES herself several times. It hurt like hell. She CRIES out but continues until she hears a CRACK. BLOOD SPEWS FORTH. It’s broken. Jill SOBS in genuine pain But, she’s not done. She leans down closer to Charlie’s body. Takes his other hand and places it on her head, clamping down on her hair. She takes a BEAT to prepare herself. Then, YANKS AWAY. RIPPING a large CLUMP OF HAIR from her own scalp. Jill SCREAMS in pain. That fucking hurt. She throws Charlie’s hand to the floor -- hair clutched i his dead fingers. Then, she sees GALE begin to stir again Jill moves fast. She stands up and quickly moves -- racin backwards, free falling into...

dialogues.speaker: THE GLASS COFFEE TABLE
dialogues.text: It SHATTERS to pieces. Jill lay there engulfed by the table’s frame. GLASS is everywhere. Beat. She attempts to rise -- it takes a few tries. As she CRIES OUT. She’s tru hurting now.

dialogues.speaker: JILL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Help me... Somebody help me... Glass shards stick out of her arm, back and shoulders. Bl streaks her arms. Jill tries to get up, but can’t... She lay there CRYING ... WHIMPERING ... As Jill lay there, hurt and bleeding. Her face full of helpless innocence. The moment DISSOLVES TO: EXT. KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT - LATER The aftermath. Flashing SQUAD CARS and AMBULANCES. The carnage is overwhelming. POLICE barricade the property. MEDIA gawk from a distance. On a stretcher in the back of an AMBULANCE, Jill’s wounds being treated. Her shirt has been cut up the back side, a little pieces of glass are being picked from her flesh. We reveal Dewey standing alone, staring guiltily at this horror show. Eyes full of tears.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: This wasn’t your fault.  110 Dewey doesn’t speak. He’s terribly shaken.

dialogues.speaker: GALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: At least Jill’s okay. Dewey silently nods. Gale hugs him tighter.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE AMBULANCE
dialogues.text: Jill sits in the back, weakly talking to Dewey. Laying ou her cover story.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Charlie told me he and Trevor had planned this since last year. He said they were Billy and Stu all over again. Except that this was going to be the reboot of all time. In the B.G., NEWS REPORTERS and PRESS PHOTOGRAPHERS shout

dialogues.speaker: PRESS
dialogues.text: JILL! JILL! Look OVER HERE!! Jill timidly squints at Dewey. A helpless little girl fac

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What should I do?

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: I gotta warn you. For the rest of your life, they’re never gonna leave you alone.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (fake overwhelmed) Maybe I'll just... give them one picture. So they’1ll go away... Wincing, hamming up the pain, Jill “trembles” and lifts herself to her feet with Dewey’s assistance. Then -- she steps around the edge of the ambulance. FLASH! FLASH! FLASH! FLASH! FLASH! The yard BLAZES WHITE WITH CAMERA FLASHES, like Yankee Stadium lit up at night. Just then, an OFFICER announces from inside the house --

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: We have one alive. A woman. Dewey and Gale light up with this news.  111

dialogues.speaker: DEWEY
dialogues.text: You mean Sidney? AND CRASH AND BURN.
